original: @81b # // rgya gar skad du /

translated: In Sanskrit:

original: shr'i ya m'a ri tanhra panydzi ka sa ha dz'a lo ka n'a ma /
analyzed: shr'i ya m'a ri tanhra panydzi ka sa ha dz'a lo ka n'a ma /
translated: Śrī-Yamāri-tantrapañjikā-sahājñānālokanāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: dpal gshin rje gshed kyi rgyud kyi dka' 'grel lhan cig skyes pa'i snang ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dpal gshin rje gshed kyi rgyud kyi dka' 'grel lhan cig skyes pa'i snang ba zhes bya ba /
translated: The Commentary on the Tantra of Glorious Yamarī called The Light of Co-Emergence

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Omniscient One.

original: dngos po kun gyi bla ma rnams //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi bla ma rnams //
translated: The gurus of all things,

original: zab mo rdo rje 'chang btud de //
analyzed: zab mo rdo rje 'chang btud de //
translated: Bowing to the profound Vajradhara,

original: dpal ldan gshin rje'i dka' 'grel ni //
analyzed: dpal ldan gshin rje'i dka' 'grel ni //
translated: The glorious Yamarī commentary,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i snang ba bri //🔽lung dang tshad mas dpyod pa yi //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i snang ba bri // lung dang tshad mas dpyod pa yi //
translated: The Light of Co-Emergence, is written.🔽Even to the clear-minded who analyze

original: blo gsal rnams la'ang sbas pa la //🔽sgra tsam nyid kyang mi shes pa'i //
analyzed: blo gsal rnams la'ang sbas pa la // sgra tsam nyid kyang mi shes pa'i //
translated: With scripture and logic, it is concealed.🔽What need to mention the confused

original: bdag 'dra rmongs pa smos ci dgos //
analyzed: bdag 'dra rmongs pa smos ci dgos //
translated: Like myself, who do not even know the mere words?

original: 'on kyang bla ma'i zab mo'i bka'i //
analyzed: 'on kyang bla ma'i zab mo'i bka'i //
translated: Nevertheless, by the profound command🔽Of the guru, whatever meaning is attained

original: cung zad don thob thos skyes gang //
analyzed: cung zad don thob thos skyes gang //
translated: From hearing, that much I will recall

original: bdag ni yongs su ngal ba yis //🔽de yi don ni dran par bya //
analyzed: bdag ni yongs su ngal ba yis //🔽de yi don ni dran par bya //
translated: With this weariness of mine.

original: thams cad du rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams dgos pa mthong nas 'jug pa yin pas /
analyzed: thams cad du rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams dgos pa mthong nas 'jug pa yin pas /
translated: Since those who are rationalists engage in a treatise after they see its purpose,

original: de'i phyir dang por 'jug pa'i yan lag tu thun mong ma yin pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa'i rgyu dgos pa bsgrub par nus pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang por 'jug pa'i yan lag tu thun mong ma yin pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa'i rgyu dgos pa bsgrub par nus pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: first, as a branch of engagement, the capability of accomplishing the purpose, which is the cause of attaining the uncommon result, should be stated.🔽Also, it is taught:

original: gang yang // bstan bcos dag ni thams cad dang // las rnams dag ni 'ga' zhig la //
analyzed: gang yang // bstan bcos dag ni thams cad dang // las rnams dag ni 'ga' zhig la //
translated: All treatises and some actions

original: ji srid dgos pa ma smras par //
analyzed: ji srid dgos pa ma smras par //
translated: Until the purpose is stated,

original: de srid su zhig len par byed //🔽ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de srid su zhig len par byed // ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: Who will take them up?

original: de yang 'brel pa dang rjod par byed pa ma bstan par rtogs par mi nus pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang 'brel pa dang rjod par byed pa ma bstan par rtogs par mi nus pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And that also cannot be understood without teaching the connection and the expression.

original: 'brel pa dang rjod par byed pa yang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang rjod par byed pa yang bstan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the connection and the expression should be taught.

original: thabs med par yang bsgrub par mi nus pas thabs kyang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs med par yang bsgrub par mi nus pas thabs kyang bstan par bya'o //
translated: Also, since it cannot be accomplished without a method, the method should be taught.

original: de la bdag dang gzhan gyi bde ba mchog gi rgyu bcom ldan 'das gshin rje gshed nag po'i rgyud nyid 'dir brjod par bya ba ste 'dir dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag dang gzhan gyi bde ba mchog gi rgyu bcom ldan 'das gshin rje gshed nag po'i rgyud nyid 'dir brjod par bya ba ste 'dir dgos pa'o //
translated: The cause of the supreme bliss of self and other is the Bhagavat Krshnayamari Tantra itself, which is to be expressed here, which is the purpose here.

original: de gang gis nges par ston par byed pa de yang rjod par byed pa yin pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa snyan dngags kyis ston pa ltar rgyud la yang gshin rje gshed nag po zhes de skad brjod do //
analyzed: de gang gis nges par ston par byed pa de yang rjod par byed pa yin pas sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa snyan dngags kyis ston pa ltar rgyud la yang gshin rje gshed nag po zhes de skad brjod do //
translated: Since that which definitely teaches that is also the expresser, the Buddha's deeds are expressed in poetry, and the tantra is also called Krshnayamari, thus it is expressed.

original: rjod byed dang brjod bya 'di dag gi rjod pa dang brjod bya'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa yang don gyi shugs kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rjod byed dang brjod bya 'di dag gi rjod pa dang brjod bya'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa yang don gyi shugs kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The connection, which is the characteristic of the expresser and the expressed, is also taught by the power of the meaning.

original: 'dir thabs kyang gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pas dbang bskur ba thob pas rnal 'byor bzhi bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te /
analyzed: 'dir thabs kyang gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pas dbang bskur ba thob pas rnal 'byor bzhi bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid can yin te /
translated: Here, the method is also the characteristic of cultivating the four yogas through going for refuge to the three, generating the mind of enlightenment, and obtaining empowerment through entering the mandala and so on.

original: gang gi phyir 'dis bdag de'i ngo bor mngon sum du 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dis bdag de'i ngo bor mngon sum du 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: Because this directly perceives the self’s nature.

original: de phyir yang dag yang dag min //🔽shin @82a * //
analyzed: de phyir yang dag yang dag min // shin @82a * //
translated: Therefore, it is real and unreal.

original: tu bsgoms pa gang gang yin //🔽bsgom pa'i stobs ni rdzogs pa na //🔽de gsal mi rtogs blo'i 'bras bu //
analyzed: tu bsgoms pa gang gang yin // bsgom pa'i stobs ni rdzogs pa na // de gsal mi rtogs blo'i 'bras bu //
translated: Whatever is well cultivated🔽is the result of the mind’s clarity and nonconceptuality

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: when the power of meditation is complete.

original: gal te ji ltar na 'di thun mong ma yin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar na 'di thun mong ma yin pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, how is this not common?

original: brjod par bya ste thams cad kyang thams cad du bdag nyid kyis bde ba'i don du 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste thams cad kyang thams cad du bdag nyid kyis bde ba'i don du 'jug pa yin te /
translated: We reply: All beings engage in actions for the sake of their own happiness.

original: de yang 'di ltar spang bya dang bsgrub bya mi shes pas mu stegs pa rnams ni lha dang mi'i bde ba 'dod pa nyid kyis 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar spang bya dang bsgrub bya mi shes pas mu stegs pa rnams ni lha dang mi'i bde ba 'dod pa nyid kyis 'jug par byed de /
translated: However, because they do not know what to abandon and what to adopt, tīrthikas engage in actions because they desire the happiness of gods and humans.

original: chu dang me la sogs pa'i nang du bdag nyid 'jug pa dang / 'dab ma dang nas la sogs pa za ba dang gcig la slong ba dang gnyis la slong ba la sogs pa'i lus la gnod pa byed kyang /
analyzed: chu dang me la sogs pa'i nang du bdag nyid 'jug pa dang / 'dab ma dang nas la sogs pa za ba dang gcig la slong ba dang gnyis la slong ba la sogs pa'i lus la gnod pa byed kyang /
translated: They engage in actions such as entering the water, fire, and so on; eating leaves, barley, and so on; harming their bodies by begging from one house and then two houses, and so on.

original: re zhig de la sogs pa'i dka' blas kyi brtul zhugs kyis spyod na yang 'bras bu bde ba ni med do //
analyzed: re zhig de la sogs pa'i dka' blas kyi brtul zhugs kyis spyod na yang 'bras bu bde ba ni med do //
translated: Even if one practices for a while with difficult austerities, there is no result of happiness.🔽Because

original: gang gi phyir //
analyzed: gang gi phyir //
translated: it is said:

original: sdug bsngal la sogs sems g-yengs nas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs sems g-yengs nas //
translated: When the mind is distracted by suffering, etc.,

original: g-yengs pas dngos grub gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yengs pas dngos grub gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: distraction causes accomplishment to be elsewhere.

original: dngos grub med na 'khor ba ste //
analyzed: dngos grub med na 'khor ba ste //
translated: If there is no accomplishment, there is saṃsāra.

original: 'khor bas dmyal bsgrub par byed //🔽ces gsungs pas so //
analyzed: 'khor bas dmyal bsgrub par byed // ces gsungs pas so //
translated: From saṃsāra, one accomplishes hell.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa yang dngos po ma lus pa'i de kho na nyid yongs su mi shes pas phung po med pa'i bde ba mchog yin no zhes bya bar shes nas bdag nyid mya ngan las 'das par nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa yang dngos po ma lus pa'i de kho na nyid yongs su mi shes pas phung po med pa'i bde ba mchog yin no zhes bya bar shes nas bdag nyid mya ngan las 'das par nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, śrāvakas, etc., not fully understanding the reality of all things, knowing that the supreme bliss of the absence of aggregates is so, they will certainly attain nirvāṇa for themselves.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la spyod pa yang sbyin pa la sogs pa la zhugs na yang rtag tu stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la spyod pa yang sbyin pa la sogs pa la zhugs na yang rtag tu stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa nyid kyis longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis su med pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, those practicing the vehicle of perfections, even when engaged in generosity, etc., always by the sameness of taste in emptiness, the enjoyment and emanation bodies are nondual.

original: snying rje dman pas bdag nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa gtsor byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: snying rje dman pas bdag nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa gtsor byed pa nyid do //
translated: But because of his inferior compassion, he himself makes nirvana his goal.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthar thug pa phyir mi ldog pa gang yin pa de yang sangs rgyas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthar thug pa phyir mi ldog pa gang yin pa de yang sangs rgyas ni ma yin te /
translated: And that which is the culmination of the perfections, the stage of nonretrogression, is not buddhahood,

original: de lta na ni sa bcu par sangs rgyas par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni sa bcu par sangs rgyas par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because if it were, it would follow, absurdly, that one would become a buddha on the tenth stage.🔽Moreover, even though one has directly perceived the profound, one is not able to benefit sentient beings, because one is not the omniscient one who is the support of the entire world.

original: gzhan yang zab mo mngon sum du byas pa nyid yin yang sems can gyi don ni med de 'gro ba ma lus par nye bar 'tsho bar gyur pa de thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su 'dod na bdag med pa'i mthar thug pa la 'jug par byed pa
analyzed: gzhan yang zab mo mngon sum du byas pa nyid yin yang sems can gyi don ni med de 'gro ba ma lus par nye bar 'tsho bar gyur pa de thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su 'dod na bdag med pa'i mthar thug pa la 'jug par byed pa
translated: The cause of that is not the mere realization of the ultimate reality of selflessness,

original: nyid kyi rgyu ni ma yin te de ni brtags pa'i gnyen po tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid kyi rgyu ni ma yin te de ni brtags pa'i gnyen po tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is merely the antidote to the artificial self.🔽And that is also said:

original: de yang // thabs dang bral ba'i dngos med tsam //
analyzed: de yang // thabs dang bral ba'i dngos med tsam //
translated: The mere nonexistence of things, devoid of method,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'ang ma yin te //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'ang ma yin te //
translated: is not the goal to be achieved.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub mthu //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub mthu //
translated: Because it lacks the power to accomplish the welfare of self and other,

original: med phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //
analyzed: med phyir nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //
translated: it is like a sky flower.

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is taught.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa thabs kyi sgo nas dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis 'byung @82b par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par yang mi bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa thabs kyi sgo nas dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis 'byung @82b par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par yang mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be said that the enjoyment body and emanation body arise from the power of the perfection of generosity and so on, nor from the power of aspiration.

original: gang gi phyir ma bsgoms pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i bdag nyid dag la yang the tshom za ba na ji ltar sems nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma bsgoms pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i bdag nyid dag la yang the tshom za ba na ji ltar sems nges par 'gyur /
translated: Because if one doubts that the enjoyment body and emanation body arise from meditation, how can one be certain?

original: de ltar na yang smon lam gyi stobs kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang smon lam gyi stobs kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one says that they arise from the power of aspiration,

original: bdag med pa yang ma bsgoms pa nyid du mngon sum nyid du 'gyur bas de bsgom pa'i ngal bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: bdag med pa yang ma bsgoms pa nyid du mngon sum nyid du 'gyur bas de bsgom pa'i ngal bas ci zhig bya /
translated: then it is clear that the selflessness of persons is not cultivated in meditation, so what is the point of the trouble of meditating on it?

original: gal te de ni bsgoms pa nyid kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ni bsgoms pa nyid kyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one says that it arises from the cultivation of meditation,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis kyis nyes pa ci zhig byas na gang gi phyir de dag bsgom par mi bya /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis kyis nyes pa ci zhig byas na gang gi phyir de dag bsgom par mi bya /
translated: then what is wrong with the enjoyment body and emanation body that they are not cultivated in meditation?

original: de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la gnas pas kyang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi sangs rgyas khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la gnas pas kyang sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyi sangs rgyas khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even those who follow the Perfection Vehicle must accept the Buddha who is the embodiment of the three bodies.

original: de ni bsgoms pas gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni bsgoms pas gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This is made clear by meditation.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir // sangs rgyas nyid ni sgrub pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: de'i phyir // sangs rgyas nyid ni sgrub pa'i rgyu //
translated: the cause for attaining Buddhahood🔽is the yoga of the Buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas rnal 'byor kun du yang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnal 'byor kun du yang //
translated: Is it not seen everywhere

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu nyid //🔽kun du mthong ba ma yin nam //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu nyid // kun du mthong ba ma yin nam //
translated: that the effect resembles the cause?

original: zhes bstan ba dang thams cad gsang ba las kyang //
analyzed: zhes bstan ba dang thams cad gsang ba las kyang //
translated: And in the Sarvarahasyatantra,

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyang mdor bsdu na //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyang mdor bsdu na //
translated: Buddhahood, in brief,

original: ting 'dzin ye shes las nges 'byung //
analyzed: ting 'dzin ye shes las nges 'byung //
translated: is definitely produced from the wisdom of samadhi.

original: sangs rgyas rnal 'byor ma gtogs par //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnal 'byor ma gtogs par //
translated: Except for the yoga of the Buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas rnal 'byor pas mi thob //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnal 'byor pas mi thob //
translated: Buddhahood is not attained by the yoga of the Buddhas.

original: ces gsungs pas sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor yang sems can ma lus pa 'dul bas khro zhing zhi ba'i bdag nyid can gshin rje gshed nag po nyid do //
analyzed: ces gsungs pas sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor yang sems can ma lus pa 'dul bas khro zhing zhi ba'i bdag nyid can gshin rje gshed nag po nyid do //
translated: Thus, the yoga of the Buddhas is also the yoga of Yamantaka, who is wrathful and peaceful by nature in order to subdue all sentient beings without exception.

original: bya ba dang spyod pa'i lugs la yang bsgrub bya dang sgrub pa'i thabs dus ring por rjes su mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: bya ba dang spyod pa'i lugs la yang bsgrub bya dang sgrub pa'i thabs dus ring por rjes su mi 'jug ste /
translated: Also, in the system of action and performance, one does not engage for a long time in the means of achieving the goal.

original: de dag ni brtags pa las rab tu byung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni brtags pa las rab tu byung ba nyid yin te /
translated: They are fully ordained by examination,

original: de ni 'di ltar ras ris la sogs par rtogs pa'i lha'i stobs kyis dngos grub rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar ras ris la sogs par rtogs pa'i lha'i stobs kyis dngos grub rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they perfect the powers of the deity realized in the painting, etc.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud du ni khyad par 'di yod de rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyis ras ris la sogs par rtogs pa'i lha la dmigs nas mthun pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud du ni khyad par 'di yod de rang gi lha'i rnal 'byor gyis ras ris la sogs par rtogs pa'i lha la dmigs nas mthun pa'i dngos grub sgrub par byed do //
translated: In the Yoga Tantra, this is the difference: by the yoga of one's deity, one visualizes the deity realized in the painting, etc., and achieves the concordant powers.

original: rnal 'byor bla na med par ni gtso bo nyid du de rgyu'i gtso bor ma bstan no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor bla na med par ni gtso bo nyid du de rgyu'i gtso bor ma bstan no //
translated: In the Highest Yoga Tantra, that is not taught as the principal cause.

original: 'dir ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul ba'i bdag nyid can cig tu 'gro ba ma lus pa la phan par byed pa zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin can bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor gyis chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul ba'i bdag nyid can cig tu 'gro ba ma lus pa la phan par byed pa zag pa med pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin can bstan te /
translated: Here, it is taught that by the yoga of the non-duality of means and insight, one becomes the nature of the dharmakaya, sambhogakaya, and nirmanakaya, and benefits all beings without exception, with the nature of undefiled bliss.

original: des na thun mong ma yin pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin bas bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: des na thun mong ma yin pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'i rgyu nyid yin bas bla na med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is unsurpassed because it is the very cause of attaining the uncommon result.

original: taksha ka'i mgo la yod pa'i rims nad sel ba'i gtsug gi nor bu bzhin @83a * //
analyzed: taksha ka'i mgo la yod pa'i rims nad sel ba'i gtsug gi nor bu bzhin @83a * //
translated: It is not like the crest jewel that removes the fever of the head of Takshaka,

original: du bsgrub par mi nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: du bsgrub par mi nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it impossible to accomplish.

original: gang gi phyir yul ma lus pa la brten cing bsgrubs pas gsal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul ma lus pa la brten cing bsgrubs pas gsal por 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it becomes clear by relying on and accomplishing all objects without exception.🔽What is it like? It is the very cause of leading to the special result, like the use of poison purified by mantra, etc.

original: de ji lta bu zhig ce na sngags la sogs pas sbyangs pa'i dug la spyod pa ltar khyad par can gyi 'bras bu 'dren par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhig ce na sngags la sogs pas sbyangs pa'i dug la spyod pa ltar khyad par can gyi 'bras bu 'dren par byed pa nyid do //
translated: And that is so,

original: de yang / ji ltar dug gi de nyid rig / dug gis dug ni sel bar byed //
analyzed: de yang / ji ltar dug gi de nyid rig / dug gis dug ni sel bar byed //
translated: Just as one who knows the reality of poison removes poison with poison.

original: de bzhin 'dod pa'i rtsed mo'i ros //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod pa'i rtsed mo'i ros //
translated: Likewise, with the taste of desired play,

original: brtags pa thams cad sbyor bar bya //
analyzed: brtags pa thams cad sbyor bar bya //
translated: one should engage in all the imagined.

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las kyang //
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las kyang //
translated: Also, in the glorious Guhyasamaja,🔽it is said:

original: dka' thub sdom pa mi zad pas //
analyzed: dka' thub sdom pa mi zad pas //
translated: Even if one relies on austerities and vows,

original: brten kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: brten kyang 'grub par mi 'gyur te //
translated: one will not attain accomplishment.

original: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod cing ;
analyzed: 'dod pa kun la longs spyod cing ;
translated: If one relies on enjoying all desires,

original: / brten na myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: / brten na myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: one will quickly attain accomplishment.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: da ni 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pas dgos pa dang bsdus pa'i don dang tshig gi don dang / 'brel pa dang / rgal ba dang / lan rnams brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pas dgos pa dang bsdus pa'i don dang tshig gi don dang / 'brel pa dang / rgal ba dang / lan rnams brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, from here on, one should explain the purpose, the summarized meaning, the meaning of the words, the connection, the objections, and the replies.

original: de la re zhig dgos pa smras zin to //
analyzed: de la re zhig dgos pa smras zin to //
translated: Among those, first, the purpose has already been stated.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni mngon par rtogs pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni mngon par rtogs pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: The summarized meaning should be understood from the realization.

original: da ni 'brel pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshig 'ga' zhig gis bshad pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni 'brel pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshig 'ga' zhig gis bshad pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, one should explain with some words that precede the connection.

original: rgal ba dang lan ni de dang der bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: rgal ba dang lan ni de dang der bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The objections and replies should be established in each case.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Here, from thus have I heard and so on,

original: 'dir sdud par byed pa phyag na rdo rjes rgyud ma lus pa'i don dang gzhung sems la bsngogs nas 'di skad ces nges par byas nas rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pas nges par bzung ba'i rgyud kyi don ma lus par nye bar ston pa la gcig🔽tu nges pa byas nas phyin ci ma log par smras pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir sdud par byed pa phyag na rdo rjes rgyud ma lus pa'i don dang gzhung sems la bsngogs nas 'di skad ces nges par byas nas rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i shes pas nges par bzung ba'i rgyud kyi don ma lus par nye bar ston pa la gcig tu nges pa byas nas phyin ci ma log par smras pa'o //
translated: Here, the compiler Vajrapāṇi, having searched the meaning and text of the entire tantra, having ascertained it in this way, and having ascertained the meaning of the tantra with a consciousness that accords with himself, he speaks without error, having ascertained it as being solely the teaching of the entire meaning of the tantra.

original: bdag gi zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du thos pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du thos pa ste /
translated: “I” means that he heard it directly from himself.

original: bcom ldan 'das las bdag gis don dang gzhung dag thos kyi bdag gis byas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las bdag gis don dang gzhung dag thos kyi bdag gis byas pa yang ma yin /
translated: “I heard this meaning and text from the Bhagavān” means that it was not composed by himself,

original: bcom ldan 'das las gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas bstan pa yang ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas bstan pa yang ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: nor was it taught by a lineage from the Bhagavān.

original: yang na bdag rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis 'di skad thos kyi gzhan gyis ni gzhan du yang ma yin te 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'khor bstan pas so //
analyzed: yang na bdag rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis 'di skad thos kyi gzhan gyis ni gzhan du yang ma yin te 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'khor bstan pas so //
translated: Alternately, “I” means that this was heard by the power of my own interest, but others did not hear it in another way, as will be explained by the teaching of the retinue.

original: 'dis ni gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan dang ldan pa rnam par gcod pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: This avoids the exclusion of the possession of other.

original: slob dpon ma khol gyis kyang //
analyzed: slob dpon ma khol gyis kyang //
translated: Master Maṇiṣāśīla also says:

original: gsung gcig gis ni bstan mod kyang //
analyzed: gsung gcig gis ni bstan mod kyang //
translated: “Although it is taught in one statement,

original: du ma nyid du rtogs mdzad par //
analyzed: du ma nyid du rtogs mdzad par //
translated: it is understood as many.

original: bdag la nye bar ston to zhes //
analyzed: bdag la nye bar ston to zhes //
translated: I teach it to myself,

original: skye bo kun gyis shes par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skye bo kun gyis shes par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and all people know it.”

original: thos pas zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid nyan pa'i dus na byang @83b chub sems dpa' nyid du bstan la /
analyzed: thos pas zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid nyan pa'i dus na byang @83b chub sems dpa' nyid du bstan la /
translated: By saying “having heard,” it shows that at the time of listening, he was a bodhisattva himself.

original: sdug pa'i dus na ni 'dis sangs rgyas nyid yin te /
analyzed: sdug pa'i dus na ni 'dis sangs rgyas nyid yin te /
translated: At the time of delight, he was a buddha.

original: gang gi phyir le'u bco brgyad pa las //
analyzed: gang gi phyir le'u bco brgyad pa las //
translated: Because in the eighteenth chapter it says:

original: de'i dus na bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa thos te /
analyzed: de'i dus na bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa thos te /
translated: “At that time, I heard what the Bhagavān said,

original: skad cig ma gcig la bzung zhing don bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig la bzung zhing don bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
translated: and in one moment, I grasped the words and grasped the meaning.”

original: 'dis ni yang bstan pas shin tu yang tshad ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni yang bstan pas shin tu yang tshad ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that it is even more valid because it is taught again.

original: mngon sum du thos pas yang 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du thos pas yang 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: Having heard it directly, one should understand it in this way.

original: slob dpon med par 'di'i bya ba mi bya'o zhes yang dag par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon med par 'di'i bya ba mi bya'o zhes yang dag par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One should hold that this activity should not be done without a master.

original: de ltar bstan nas gang gi tshe gang las gang du gang dang lhan cig thos pa de dang de rim pa bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bstan nas gang gi tshe gang las gang du gang dang lhan cig thos pa de dang de rim pa bzhin bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having taught in this way, in order to teach in sequence what was heard from whom, where, and with whom,

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, at one time.

original: 'dis ni shin tu dkon pa nyid dang bdag nyid mang du thos pa nyid du sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis ni shin tu dkon pa nyid dang bdag nyid mang du thos pa nyid du sgrub par byed de /
translated: This establishes the rarity and the great learning of the self.

original: 'di lta bu'i phyin ci ma log pa ngo mtshar che ba'i chos ni gzhan gyi tshe bstan par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i phyin ci ma log pa ngo mtshar che ba'i chos ni gzhan gyi tshe bstan par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to teach such an unmistaken, wondrous Dharma at another time.

original: 'dis ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams gus pa bskyed pa bstan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams gus pa bskyed pa bstan par byed pa'o //
translated: This teaches the generation of respect in future generations.

original: dus gcig gi tshe bdag gis 'di thos kyi gzhan gyi tshe ni gzhan dang gzhan pa 'di thos so zhes mang du thos pa nyid kyang bstan to //
analyzed: dus gcig gi tshe bdag gis 'di thos kyi gzhan gyi tshe ni gzhan dang gzhan pa 'di thos so zhes mang du thos pa nyid kyang bstan to //
translated: At one time I heard this, but at another time I heard this from another - this also teaches great learning.

original: gal te yi ge dang ngag dang tshig sna tshogs pa tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir dus gcig na zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yi ge dang ngag dang tshig sna tshogs pa tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir dus gcig na zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “How is it that they were heard at one time, since the various letters, speech, and words are different?”

original: bden na yang rgyun mi chad par rtag tu thos pa'am /
analyzed: bden na yang rgyun mi chad par rtag tu thos pa'am /
translated: Although that is true, they were heard continuously, always,

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das bdag por gyur pa'i dbang gis bdag gis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo thob pas dus gcig nyid du thos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das bdag por gyur pa'i dbang gis bdag gis bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo thob pas dus gcig nyid du thos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: or else, because I attained the inconceivable door of liberation through the power of the Bhagavān as the lord, they were heard at one time.

original: gang las zhes 'dri na bcom ldan 'das las te /
analyzed: gang las zhes 'dri na bcom ldan 'das las te /
translated: If it is asked, “From whom?” they were heard from the Bhagavān.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa'i gnyen po bla na med pa'i shes rab ni bcom ldan te /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa ma lus pa'i gnyen po bla na med pa'i shes rab ni bcom ldan te /
translated: The Bhagavān is the unsurpassed wisdom that is the antidote to all afflictions and their traces.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: He who has that is the Bhagavān.🔽Moreover,

original: de yang // 'joms pa'i phyir na bcom ldan te //
analyzed: de yang // 'joms pa'i phyir na bcom ldan te //
translated: he is called the Bhagavān because he conquers.

original: nyon mongs bdud la sogs 'joms pas //
analyzed: nyon mongs bdud la sogs 'joms pas //
translated: Because he conquers the afflictions, the māras, and so on,

original: shes rab nyon mongs de 'joms phyir //
analyzed: shes rab nyon mongs de 'joms phyir //
translated: and because wisdom conquers the afflictions,

original: de phyir shes rab bcom ldan brjod //🔽ces gsungs pa dang yang na /
analyzed: de phyir shes rab bcom ldan brjod //🔽ces gsungs pa dang yang na /
translated: wisdom is called the Bhagavān.

original: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ste //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ste //
translated: Powerful, of good form, glory, fame, knowledge, and perfect in effort,

original: drug po de la ldan zhes bya //
analyzed: drug po de la ldan zhes bya //
translated: these six are called endowed.

original: zhes bya bas de dang ldan pa la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bas de dang ldan pa la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus, the one who is endowed with these is called the Blessed One.

original: de lta bur gyur pas gsungs pa ni phyin ci ma log pa zhes pa'o //🔽de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de nyid las thos pas gzhan dag @84a * //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pas gsungs pa ni phyin ci ma log pa zhes pa'o // de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das de nyid las thos pas gzhan dag @84a * //
translated: What is spoken by such a one is called unerring.

original: la de lta bur gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la de lta bur gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, heard from the Blessed One himself means that it is not like that from others.

original: 'dis ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of the teacher.

original: gnas gang du thos zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: gnas gang du thos zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: As for the question where was it heard?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said in the realm of Akaniṣṭha, and so on.

original: de bzhin ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: Suchness is the essence of non-dual wisdom.

original: rang rang gi rang bzhin gyis de bzhin nyid du song bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ste chos kyi sku'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi rang bzhin gyis de bzhin nyid du song bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ste chos kyi sku'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Having gone to suchness by their own nature, they are the Tathāgatas, the essence of the Dharma body.

original: kun rdzob tu ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i gzugs nyid kyis rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gang dang gis 'jig rten la snang bar 'gyur ba'i gzugs de dang der gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i gzugs nyid kyis rang gi mos pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gang dang gis 'jig rten la snang bar 'gyur ba'i gzugs de dang der gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: In the relative, however, he is the Tathāgata because he goes in that and that form which appears in the world by way of his own inclinations, by means of the form of the Enjoyment Body and the Emanation Body.

original: chos kyi sku nyid yin na yang snying rje'i dbang gis de bzhin du snang ba yin gyi de kho na nyid la ni rtog pa ma lus pa mi mnga' bas gar yang gshegs pa med do //🔽thams cad kyang yin la de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: chos kyi sku nyid yin na yang snying rje'i dbang gis de bzhin du snang ba yin gyi de kho na nyid la ni rtog pa ma lus pa mi mnga' bas gar yang gshegs pa med do // thams cad kyang yin la de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin pas /
translated: Although it is the Dharma Body itself, it appears in that way by the power of compassion, but in reality, since it does not have any conceptualization at all, it does not go anywhere.🔽Since it is all and it is the Tathāgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de /
translated: it is all the Tathāgatas.

original: gti mug gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug gshin rje gshed la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the Tathāgatas of Delusion, of Death, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje btsun mo thams cad kyi bha ga ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje btsun mo thams cad kyi bha ga ste /
translated: Their Body, Speech, and Mind are the bhaga of all the Tathāgatas and all the Vajra Queens.

original: mi phyed cing 'byed par byed pas byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / bla na med pa'i dga' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos 'byung gi phyag rgya gru gsum nyid de /
analyzed: mi phyed cing 'byed par byed pas byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / bla na med pa'i dga' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir chos 'byung gi phyag rgya gru gsum nyid de /
translated: Since it is the nature of the mind of enlightenment, which is indivisible and causes division, and since it is the cause of unsurpassed bliss, and since it is the nature of body, speech, and mind, the triangle is the mudra of the source of phenomena.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'og tu zur gcig steng du zur gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir 'og tu zur gcig steng du zur gnyis pa'o //
translated: Since it is the nature of the purity of the desire, form, and formless realms, it has one point below and two points above.

original: 'dis ni 'di ltar bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di ltar bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: gang gi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa'i sems can rjes su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: When the Bhagavān, in order to take care of sentient beings who engage in desire and so on,

original: gshin rje gshed kyi tshogs chen po dang lhan cig bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i gzhal yas khang na bzhugs pa de'i tshe 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed kyi tshogs chen po dang lhan cig bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'byung gnas kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i gzhal yas khang na bzhugs pa de'i tshe 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: resides in the celestial mansion included within the source of phenomena together with the great assembly of Yamāntaka, at that time it is said, “Thus have I heard.”

original: 'dis ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the excellence of the place.

original: 'di lta bu'i khyad par can gyi gnas su 'dod chags chen pos 'dul ba rnams yid mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i khyad par can gyi gnas su 'dod chags chen pos 'dul ba rnams yid mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: In such an excellent place, those to be converted by great passion will be caused to settle their minds in meditative concentration.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnams kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid so sor rtogs pa bzod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnams kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid so sor rtogs pa bzod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those whose minds are in meditative concentration will gain the acceptance of the reality of things just as it is.

original: des na 'di dag la 'di ni phan gdags pa chen po nyid yin no //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems mnyam par @84b 'jog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di dag la 'di ni phan gdags pa chen po nyid yin no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las kyang bde ba dang ldan pa'i sems mnyam par @84b 'jog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, this is the great benefit for them.🔽And the Perfection of Wisdom also says, “The mind endowed with happiness enters into meditative concentration.

original: sems mnyam par bzhag pas yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag pas yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The mind in meditative concentration comes to know things just as they are.”

original: mang po'i tshig nyid ni 'jig rten gsum po ma lus pa'i rngul phra rab so so'i khongs su gtogs pa'i chos 'byung gi nang gi gzhal yas khang gi nang na dkyil 'khor pa thams cad dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das rang gi rig ma dang gnyis su🔽med par snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mang po'i tshig nyid ni 'jig rten gsum po ma lus pa'i rngul phra rab so so'i khongs su gtogs pa'i chos 'byung gi nang gi gzhal yas khang gi nang na dkyil 'khor pa thams cad dang lhan cig tu bcom ldan 'das rang gi rig ma dang gnyis su med par snang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The many words are that the Bhagavān, together with all the maṇḍala deities, appears in the celestial mansion within the dharmodaya that belongs to each of the atoms of sweat of the three worlds without distinction.

original: bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gdul bya'i 'gro ba'i sems 'phrog par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bzhugs te zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis gdul bya'i 'gro ba'i sems 'phrog par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “abides” is that he captivates the minds of the disciples through various miracles.

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag nyid cha ba dang / phan pa chen po mdzad pa nyid dang / dbang po dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag nyid cha ba dang / phan pa chen po mdzad pa nyid dang / dbang po dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the Bhagavān as having a great body, performing great benefits, and possessing the sense organs,

original: 'khor 'dus pa chen po nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'khor 'dus pa chen po nyid gsungs pa /
translated: the great assembly of retinue is mentioned.

original: gti mug rdo rje gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la gcig dang du ma la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis chos thams cad la rtogs pa med pa dang shes pa med pa ni gti mug ste /
analyzed: gti mug rdo rje gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la gcig dang du ma la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyis chos thams cad la rtogs pa med pa dang shes pa med pa ni gti mug ste /
translated: Delusion-Vajra-Yamari. Delusion is the non-apprehension and non-perception of all things by virtue of their freedom from unity and multiplicity, etc.

original: de nyid ni gzugs brnyan ltar mi 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir mi phyed pa dang / de las gzhan pa 'byed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje yang yin te /
analyzed: de nyid ni gzugs brnyan ltar mi 'khrul pa nyid kyi phyir mi phyed pa dang / de las gzhan pa 'byed par byed pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje yang yin te /
translated: That itself is the vajra because it is indivisible, since it is non-erroneous like a reflection, and it is the vajra because it is the divider of that which is other than it.🔽It is the Yamari of death, since it is the destroyer of the death of nirvana,

original: byams pa chen po mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'chi ba'i gshin rje 'joms pas /
analyzed: byams pa chen po mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir / mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'chi ba'i gshin rje 'joms pas /
translated: because it is the realization of great compassion.

original: de'i phyir gti mug rdo rje gshin rje gshed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir gti mug rdo rje gshin rje gshed de /
translated: Therefore, it is the delusion-vajra-Yamari.

original: des kyang der thos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang der thos zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that he hears that in that place.

original: phra ma rdo rje gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la gzhan 'byed pa'i tshig ni phra ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phra ma rdo rje gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la gzhan 'byed pa'i tshig ni phra ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Divisive speech-vajra-Yamari. Divisive speech is the speech that divides others.

original: de la gzhan ni phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan ni phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba ste /
translated: Others here are those who maintain that external objects exist.

original: rigs pa dang lung gis phye zhing sun phyung nas rang dang mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyud la sbyor bar byed de zhes bya ba rang dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dbyer med pa dang des gzhan dga' byed pa nyid kyis rdo rje zhes bya la
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung gis phye zhing sun phyung nas rang dang mnyam pa nyid kyi rgyud la sbyor bar byed de zhes bya ba rang dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis dbyer med pa dang des gzhan dga' byed pa nyid kyis rdo rje zhes bya la
translated: The one of the same nature is called vajra because of being inseparable by nature and because of delighting others.

original: / snying rje chen po rang bzhin gyis mngon sum du byas pa'i ngo bo sa mi 'dra ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gshin rje gshed nag po yin pas phra mo rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: / snying rje chen po rang bzhin gyis mngon sum du byas pa'i ngo bo sa mi 'dra ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i gshin rje gshed nag po yin pas phra mo rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
translated: The one who has realized the nature of great compassion, the essence of the different stages of nirvana, is called black Yamantaka, thus subtle vajra Yamantaka.

original: 'dod chags rdo rje gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la sems can gyi don la so sor rtog pa la zhen pa ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags rdo rje gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la sems can gyi don la so sor rtog pa la zhen pa ni chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment vajra Yamantaka is attachment to the discernment of the purpose of sentient beings.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi phyed pa dang gzhan 'byed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang dga' ba chen po mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi phyed pa dang gzhan 'byed par byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang dga' ba chen po mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir /
translated: It is called vajra because of being indivisible by nature and because of causing division in others, and because of realizing great joy.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas bskyed pa'i mya ngan las 'das @85a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas bskyed pa'i mya ngan las 'das @85a * //
translated: The Lord of Death, who is the sorrow produced by the absence of passion, is conquered by the passionless one.🔽Therefore, he is called the Lord of Death, who is the Vajra of Passion.

original: pa'i 'chi ba'i gshin rje 'joms pas 'dod chags rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: pa'i 'chi ba'i gshin rje 'joms pas 'dod chags rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
translated: The Lord of Death, who is the sorrow produced by the absence of envy, is conquered by the one who is the Vajra of Envy.

original: phrag dog rdo rje gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba dang / phrag dog ni gzhan gyi yon tan la sdang ba ste /
analyzed: phrag dog rdo rje gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba dang / phrag dog ni gzhan gyi yon tan la sdang ba ste /
translated: Envy is the hatred of the good qualities of others.

original: rang rang gi sems can gyi don byed pa grub pa la gzhan gyis mi bya ste de bdag gis bya'o zhes rnam par snang ba'o //
analyzed: rang rang gi sems can gyi don byed pa grub pa la gzhan gyis mi bya ste de bdag gis bya'o zhes rnam par snang ba'o //
translated: It is the appearance of the thought, “I alone should do the work of benefiting all sentient beings, and no one else should do it.”

original: bya ba nan tan nyid kyi phyir mi phyed cing 'byed par byed pas rdo rje ste /
analyzed: bya ba nan tan nyid kyi phyir mi phyed cing 'byed par byed pas rdo rje ste /
translated: The Vajra is so called because it is indivisible and because it is the means of dividing the work to be done.🔽The Lord of Death, who is the mere nirvana of one’s own benefit, is conquered by the one who is the Vajra of Great Equanimity.

original: btang snyoms chen po mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir rang gi don tsam gyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i gshin rje 'joms par byed pas phrag dog rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: btang snyoms chen po mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir rang gi don tsam gyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i gshin rje 'joms par byed pas phrag dog rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
translated: Therefore, he is called the Lord of Death, who is the Vajra of Envy.

original: zhe sdang rdo rje gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la phan tshun dga' bar mi byed pa la sdang ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: zhe sdang rdo rje gshin rje gshed dang zhes bya ba la phan tshun dga' bar mi byed pa la sdang ba ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: The one called Hatred-Vajra-Yamari is hatred because it does not mutually delight in the hatred of the non-hatred of all things.

original: yang na chos thams cad shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa la sdang ba ni bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: yang na chos thams cad shes pa dang shes bya la sogs pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa la sdang ba ni bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Or else, hatred is the reality of selflessness, because it is hatred of the establishment of the nature of all things as the knower and the known, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje ste mi phyed pa nyid dang / de las gzhan pa 'byed par byed pa'i phyir dang / snying rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byas pa nyid kyis sems can gyi don 'dor ba'i rtag tu bde ba nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das par ltung ba'i gshin rje 'joms par byed pa'i phyir zhe sdang rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rdo rje ste mi phyed pa nyid dang / de las gzhan pa 'byed par byed pa'i phyir dang / snying rje chen po'i ngo bo nyid mngon sum du byas pa nyid kyis sems can gyi don 'dor ba'i rtag tu bde ba nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das par ltung ba'i gshin rje 'joms par byed pa'i phyir zhe sdang rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
translated: For that very reason, it is a vajra, because it is indivisible, and because it is the divider of that which is other than it, and because it is the destroyer of Yama, who is the fall into nirvana of constant bliss, by the realization of the nature of great compassion. Thus, it is Hatred-Vajra-Yamari.

original: thob rdo rje gshin rje dang // zhes bya ba la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang shes bya'i sgrib pa 'jig par byed pa mtshon pas thob ste /
analyzed: thob rdo rje gshin rje dang // zhes bya ba la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang shes bya'i sgrib pa 'jig par byed pa mtshon pas thob ste /
translated: because he destroys the view of the transitory aggregates and the obscurations to be known.

original: phung po'i bdud kyi gshin rje 'joms par byed pas thob rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: phung po'i bdud kyi gshin rje 'joms par byed pas thob rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
translated: He is called Vajra-Yamari because he destroys the Yama of the Mara of the aggregates.🔽Danda-Yamari is the one who is marked with a club,

original: mthar 'dzin pa lta ba dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'jig par byed pas dbyug pas nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin pa lta ba dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'jig par byed pas dbyug pas nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: because he destroys the view of extremes and the obscurations of affliction.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud kyi gshin rje 'joms par byed pas dbyug pa gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud kyi gshin rje 'joms par byed pas dbyug pa gshin rje gshed do //
translated: He is called Danda-Yamari because he destroys the Yama of the Mara of affliction.🔽Padma-Yamari is the one who is marked with a lotus,🔽because he teaches the Dharma that is unstained by the obscurations of wrong views and birth.

original: log par lta ba dang skye ba'i sgrib pas gos pa med pa'i chos rab tu ston pa ni padmas nye bar mtshon pa yin pa dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud kyi gshin rje 'jig par byed pas padma gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: log par lta ba dang skye ba'i sgrib pas gos pa med pa'i chos rab tu ston pa ni padmas nye bar mtshon pa yin pa dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud kyi gshin rje 'jig par byed pas padma gshin rje gshed do //
translated: He is called Padma-Yamari because he destroys the Yama of the Mara of death.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang las kyi sgrib pa gcod par byed pa ni ral gris nye bar mtshon pa yin pa dang / rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i lha'i bu'i bdud kyi gshin rje 'joms par byed pas ral gri gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang las kyi sgrib pa gcod par byed pa ni ral gris nye bar mtshon pa yin pa dang / rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i lha'i bu'i bdud kyi gshin rje 'joms par byed pas ral gri gshin rje gshed do //
translated: Yama is the god of death, the son of Mara, who creates distraction, and he is conquered by the sword.

original: mi phyed pa'i byams pa chen po'i ngo bos rang gi gdul bya la spyod par byed pas rdo rje tsartsi ka'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i byams pa chen po'i ngo bos rang gi gdul bya la spyod par byed pas rdo rje tsartsi ka'o //
translated: Vajra-carcikā is the great love that is indivisible in nature, and she acts for her disciples.

original: rdo rje gti mug rdo rje gshin rje @85b gshed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gti mug rdo rje gshin rje @85b gshed la sogs pa'o //
translated: Vajra-moharāgavajrāyamantaka, etc.

original: bar ni rnams kyi mchog ste gshin rje gshed po'o //
analyzed: bar ni rnams kyi mchog ste gshin rje gshed po'o //
translated: The best of the intermediate ones is Yamāntaka.

original: hi ni de la phan pa ste byang chub la'o //
analyzed: hi ni de la phan pa ste byang chub la'o //
translated: Hi is the benefit of that, i.e., of enlightenment.

original: de yang rang gi phyag rgya dang gnyis su med par gyur pa nyid las 'thob pas des na rdo rje phag mo'o //
analyzed: de yang rang gi phyag rgya dang gnyis su med par gyur pa nyid las 'thob pas des na rdo rje phag mo'o //
translated: And that is attained from the state of non-duality with one’s own seal, and so it is Vajravārāhī.

original: bar hi zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni dbyer med pa'i shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes 'byung bas zhe sdang gi nang du lhung ba'i sems can zlog par byed cing zhe sdang las bzlog nas zhe sdang chen po la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: bar hi zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni dbyer med pa'i shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes 'byung bas zhe sdang gi nang du lhung ba'i sems can zlog par byed cing zhe sdang las bzlog nas zhe sdang chen po la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: The word bāhī means that since the wisdom of indivisible, utterly pure bliss arises, he turns away the sentient beings who have fallen into hatred, and having turned them away from hatred, he causes them to enter into great hatred.

original: de'i phyir badzra ba ra ni bcom ldan 'das nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir badzra ba ra ni bcom ldan 'das nyid do //
translated: Therefore, Vajrabāṇī is the Bhagavān himself.

original: hi ni de la phan pa nyid snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: hi ni de la phan pa nyid snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Hī means benefitting him, as before.

original: dbyer med pa'i gdul bya'i padma ma lus pa'i skye gnas yin pa'i phyir rdo rje'i mtshon ni 'dod chags rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i gdul bya'i padma ma lus pa'i skye gnas yin pa'i phyir rdo rje'i mtshon ni 'dod chags rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
translated: The vajra weapon is the desire-vajra-yāmāntaka, because he is the source of the lotus of all disciples without exception, who are indivisible.

original: de nyid ni lhan cig skyes pa'i mchog gi bde ba gnyis su med pa'i dga' ba skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni lhan cig skyes pa'i mchog gi bde ba gnyis su med pa'i dga' ba skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: He himself is the one who generates the supreme innate bliss, the nondual joy.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje dbyangs can ma'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje dbyangs can ma'o //
translated: She who has that is Vajra Sarasvatī.

original: go ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: go ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams so //
translated: Go means the sense organs such as the eyes.

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi bla na med pa'i sems can gyi don gyi ngo bo nyid du song zhing 'dzin par byed pas goo r'i ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi bla na med pa'i sems can gyi don gyi ngo bo nyid du song zhing 'dzin par byed pas goo r'i ste /
translated: The nature of the essence of the highest benefit of sentient beings, which is of the nature of that, is Gaurī.

original: phrag dog rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
analyzed: phrag dog rdo rje gshin rje gshed do //
translated: Jealousy is Yamāntaka.

original: 'di ni de la phan pa'i bla na med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas goo r'i ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de la phan pa'i bla na med pa'i lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas goo r'i ste /
translated: This is the highest benefit for that, which is the nature of the nondual innate bliss, and so is Gaurī.

original: rang gi bya ba la mi phyed pas rdo rje yang yin la de nyid goo r'i yang yin pas rdo rje goo r'i'o //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba la mi phyed pas rdo rje yang yin la de nyid goo r'i yang yin pas rdo rje goo r'i'o //
translated: It is a vajra because it is indivisible in its function, and it is Gaurī, and so it is a vajra-Gaurī.

original: mtshams su zhes bya ba ni mtshams bzhir gnas pa'i thod pa bzhi po mthong ba gshin rje gshed de //
analyzed: mtshams su zhes bya ba ni mtshams bzhir gnas pa'i thod pa bzhi po mthong ba gshin rje gshed de //
translated: In the corners means that one sees the four skull-bowls located in the four corners, which are the four Yāmas.

original: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gtso bor gyur pa gshin rje gshed kyi tshogs chen po'o //
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag gtso bor gyur pa gshin rje gshed kyi tshogs chen po'o //
translated: The phrase and so forth means that this is the great assembly of the Yāmas, of which he is the chief.

original: bcu bdun po smos pas 'di dag dang zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba yin na yang sogs pa zhes bya'i sgras ni 'di ltar sgrub par byed da /
analyzed: bcu bdun po smos pas 'di dag dang zhes bya ba brjod par bya ba yin na yang sogs pa zhes bya'i sgras ni 'di ltar sgrub par byed da /
translated: Although the phrase and so forth should be supplied to the phrase these, since seventeen are mentioned, the word and so forth is used to establish this.

original: 'di dag nyi tshe ba ma yin gyi gzhan yang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dbang po rnam par dag par grub pa rdo rje mig la sogs pa dang yang //
analyzed: 'di dag nyi tshe ba ma yin gyi gzhan yang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi dbang po rnam par dag par grub pa rdo rje mig la sogs pa dang yang //
translated: These are not just temporary, but also the pure sense faculties of the inner nature are established as the vajra eye, etc.

original: 'di skad bstan par yang 'gyur te de lta bu'i khyad par can gtso bor gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni de dag la sogs pa ste mig rdo rje la sogs pa dang / lus rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan par yang 'gyur te de lta bu'i khyad par can gtso bor gyur pa gang la yod pa de ni de dag la sogs pa ste mig rdo rje la sogs pa dang / lus rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is also taught: “That which has such special preeminence is the vajra eye, etc., and the vajra body, etc.”

original: 'di rnams kyis thams cad kyi rdo rje mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis thams cad kyi rdo rje mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par grub pa yin no //
translated: It is established that these consecrations are for all the vajra eyes, etc.

original: kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das kho na'i spyan la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni bcom ldan 'das kho na'i spyan la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that the consecrations are only for the Bhagavat’s eyes, etc.

original: de ni thams cad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'grub pa la mthun pa ma yin no zhes kho bo'i bla ma @86a * //
analyzed: de ni thams cad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'grub pa la mthun pa ma yin no zhes kho bo'i bla ma @86a * //
translated: Our teacher says that is not consistent with the accomplishment of omniscience in all ways.

original: gsung ngo // rta mchog gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i lha mo la sogs pa dang lhan cig thos so zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
analyzed: gsung ngo // rta mchog gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i lha mo la sogs pa dang lhan cig thos so zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
translated: He hears is connected with together with the goddesses of the mandala of the supreme horse and so forth.

original: da ni dngos grub dang man ngag ni bla ma la rag las par bya ba'i phyir dang rang dgar 'jug pa dgag pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa'i 'brel pa 'tshol bar bstan pa ni the tshom med par bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: da ni dngos grub dang man ngag ni bla ma la rag las par bya ba'i phyir dang rang dgar 'jug pa dgag pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa la sogs pa'i 'brel pa 'tshol bar bstan pa ni the tshom med par bsgrub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Now, in order to show that the attainment and instructions depend on the guru and to prevent engaging at will, the connection of the manifest realizations and so forth is taught in order to eliminate doubt.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du bstan na the tshom du 'gyur ba ni sgra'i don du mar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du bstan na the tshom du 'gyur ba ni sgra'i don du mar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If taught exactly as they are, they would cause doubt because the meaning of the words is unclear.

original: ji ltar dkar po rgyug ces bya bas ci khyi 'di rgyug gam 'on te dkar po'i yon tan dang ldan pa gzhan rgyug ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dkar po rgyug ces bya bas ci khyi 'di rgyug gam 'on te dkar po'i yon tan dang ldan pa gzhan rgyug ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the white one runs, it is unclear whether the dog is running or another possessing the quality of whiteness is running.

original: de lta bas na gang mkhas pa nga rgyal byed pa dag rang dgar 'jug par ma gyur cig ces bslab par bya ba'i phyir 'brel pa 'tshol bar bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang mkhas pa nga rgyal byed pa dag rang dgar 'jug par ma gyur cig ces bslab par bya ba'i phyir 'brel pa 'tshol bar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the connection is taught in order to train those who are proud of their knowledge, thinking, May they not engage at will.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das mngon par byang chub pa'i dus su zhes bya ba nas gshin rje gshed kyi khro bo chen po nges par phyung nas zhes bya ba'i bar rim par phye ba bco brgyad pa las gsungs pa'i de ma thag tu de nas zhes bya ba
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das mngon par byang chub pa'i dus su zhes bya ba nas gshin rje gshed kyi khro bo chen po nges par phyung nas zhes bya ba'i bar rim par phye ba bco brgyad pa las gsungs pa'i de ma thag tu de nas zhes bya ba
translated: In that regard, the Bhagavān, at the time of manifest enlightenment, having drawn forth the great wrathful one Yamāntaka,🔽🔽immediately after the eighteenth chapter, which is stated in the Tantra of the Wheel of Time, it says, “Then, the Bhagavān, the Great Joy, the transcendent conqueror Cakrasaṃvara, having drawn forth the great wrathful one Yamāntaka, the great hero, from his heart center, placed him in the space in front of him.”🔽

original: la sogs pa 'di ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa 'di ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: In that regard, at the time of the Bhagavat's manifest enlightenment up to having drawn forth the great wrathful one Yamantaka is the eighteenth chapter. Immediately after that, then and so forth should be viewed as follows.

original: dang po'i de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i de nas zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'am tshig gi rgyan no //
analyzed: dang po'i de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i de nas zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba'am tshig gi rgyan no //
translated: The first then and so forth is either a specification or an ornament of speech.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po rdo rje sems dpas phyag na rdo rje la bos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po rdo rje sems dpas phyag na rdo rje la bos te /
translated: The Bhagavat, the lord of all tathagatas, Vajrasattva, having addressed Vajrapani,

original: gsungs pa zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
analyzed: gsungs pa zhes bya bar 'brel lo //
translated: said is connected.

original: de la bos te gsungs pa ni 'di yin /
analyzed: de la bos te gsungs pa ni 'di yin /
translated: In that, having addressed him, this is what he said:

original: phyag na rdo rje bcom ldan 'das thub pa chen po'i bka' bzhin byed pa la phyag na rdo rje khyod 'di lta bu'i gshin rje gshed kyi khro bo'i gzugs su bsgyur la /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje bcom ldan 'das thub pa chen po'i bka' bzhin byed pa la phyag na rdo rje khyod 'di lta bu'i gshin rje gshed kyi khro bo'i gzugs su bsgyur la /
translated: Vajrapani, in accordance with the speech of the Bhagavat, the Great Sage, you should transform into the form of such a wrathful Yamantaka.

original: bdud la sogs pa sod cig ces bya ba la sogs pa rim par phye ba bco brgyad pa nas gsungs pa 'brel to //
analyzed: bdud la sogs pa sod cig ces bya ba la sogs pa rim par phye ba bco brgyad pa nas gsungs pa 'brel to //
translated: Kill the demons! and so forth, are related to the eighteenfold analysis taught in the [Hevajra Tantra] Two Examinations.

original: da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang de lta bu'i rnam pa lnga mngon par byang chub pa'i rdo rje 'chang yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das bsgom par bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang de lta bu'i rnam pa lnga mngon par byang chub pa'i rdo rje 'chang yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das bsgom par bya'o zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: Now, beginning with the words then [in the root text], it is taught that the Bhagavān should be meditated upon from the transformation of Vajradhara's manifest enlightenment with those five aspects.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then the Bhagavān and so forth.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: Then is the sound.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje 'jigs rung ba //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje 'jigs rung ba //
translated: The terrifying vajra cross

original: nam mkha'i rdo rje'i dkyil du bsam //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rdo rje'i dkyil du bsam //
translated: is imagined in the center of the vajra space.

original: zhes bya ba'i rjes thogs su'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rjes thogs su'o //
translated: This is immediately after [the verse] that says this.

original: thams cad kyang de yin la de bzhin gshegs pa yang de yin bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de gti mug rdo rje gshin rje gshegs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang de yin la de bzhin gshegs pa yang de yin bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de gti mug rdo rje gshin rje gshegs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since all are that [vajra cross] and also tathāgatas, they are all tathāgatas, meaning Mohavajra Yama and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi bdag po ni rdo rje @86b 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bdag po ni rdo rje @86b 'chang ngo //
translated: Their lord is Vajradhara.

original: bdud thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud thams cad ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: All demons are the aggregates, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang gis de dag 'dzoms par byed de gcod par byed pa de nyid ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang gis de dag 'dzoms par byed de gcod par byed pa de nyid ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
translated: By which meditative stabilization they are destroyed, that very [stabilization] is a vajra, because of the indivisibility of the nature of the extremely pure realm of truth.

original: de skad ces bya ba'i ming 'di nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje las de'i bdag nyid du nges par bstan to zhes bya ba ste rnam par spros so zhes bya ba ni don to //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba'i ming 'di nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje las de'i bdag nyid du nges par bstan to zhes bya ba ste rnam par spros so zhes bya ba ni don to //
translated: This very name is taught to be the nature of the body, speech, and mind vajras. The meaning is that it is elaborated.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of meditative stabilization, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: zla ba rdo rje sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: zla ba rdo rje sbyor ba yis //
translated: The union of the moon and vajra,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: aa la sogs pa dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug nyis 'gyur du byas pa shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi zla ba'o //
analyzed: aa la sogs pa dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu drug nyis 'gyur du byas pa shes rab kyi bdag nyid can gyi zla ba'o //
translated: The sixteen vowels, a, etc., doubled, are the moon, which has the nature of wisdom.

original: de'i steng du ka la sogs pa'i yi ge sum cu rtsa bzhi dang da dha da dha ya la sogs pa'i yi ge bzhi bcu nyis 'gyur du byas pa'i thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyi zla ba gzhan no //
analyzed: de'i steng du ka la sogs pa'i yi ge sum cu rtsa bzhi dang da dha da dha ya la sogs pa'i yi ge bzhi bcu nyis 'gyur du byas pa'i thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyi zla ba gzhan no //
translated: On top of that, there is another moon, which is the nature of method, consisting of the thirty-four consonants beginning with ka and the forty-two consonants beginning with da, dha, da, dha, ya, and so on.

original: de dag gnyi ga yang ro mnyam par gyur pa'i zla ba dang / de las gyur pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir dkar la dmar ba'i h'um las skyes pa nor bu dmar po lta bu'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga yang ro mnyam par gyur pa'i zla ba dang / de las gyur pa'i shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir dkar la dmar ba'i h'um las skyes pa nor bu dmar po lta bu'i rdo rje'o //
translated: Since both of those are moons that have become of equal taste and are the nature of wisdom and method, the vajra is born from the red-colored hūṃ and is like a red jewel.

original: de'i sbyor ba khyad par can las nyid dang mtshungs pa'i shes rab kyis 'khyud pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi rnam pa can dkar la dmar ba g-yon brkyang ba g-yas bskum pa de las gyur pa rol cing khro ba phyag g-yas pa rnams na rdo rje dang ral gri
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba khyad par can las nyid dang mtshungs pa'i shes rab kyis 'khyud pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi rnam pa can dkar la dmar ba g-yon brkyang ba g-yas bskum pa de las gyur pa rol cing khro ba phyag g-yas pa rnams na rdo rje dang ral gri
translated: From the special union of that, the form of Vajradhara is embraced by the wisdom consort who is similar to oneself, white with a red radiance, with the left leg extended and the right drawn in, with the right hands holding a vajra, a sword,

original: dang gri gug bsnams pa ;
analyzed: dang gri gug bsnams pa ;
translated: and a flaying knife,🔽and the left hands holding a blood-filled skull, a lotus,🔽and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: phyag g-yon pa rnams na 'khor lo dang padma dang thod pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa rnams na 'khor lo dang padma dang thod pa bsnams pa /
translated: The left hands hold a wheel, lotus, and skull-cup.

original: zhi ba tha mal pa rjes su 'dzin pas zhi ba /
analyzed: zhi ba tha mal pa rjes su 'dzin pas zhi ba /
translated: He is peaceful, because he guides ordinary, peaceful beings.

original: shin tu gdug pa can rjes su 'dzin pas khro bo'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: shin tu gdug pa can rjes su 'dzin pas khro bo'i gzugs can no //
translated: He has a wrathful form, because he guides extremely wicked beings.

original: nag por la lar 'dod do //
analyzed: nag por la lar 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that he is black.

original: de ni mi 'thad de gang gi phyir thams cad rjes su gzung ba'i phyir rnam par gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de gang gi phyir thams cad rjes su gzung ba'i phyir rnam par gnas pa yin la /
translated: That is not correct, because he is established as being for the sake of guiding all,

original: nag po nyid ni zhe sdang la spyod pa rjes su gzung ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nag po nyid ni zhe sdang la spyod pa rjes su gzung ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and blackness is for the sake of guiding those who engage in hatred.

original: gzhan yang rgyud gzhan nas bstan pa dang yang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyud gzhan nas bstan pa dang yang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, it contradicts what is taught in other tantras.

original: de yang dgyes pa'i rdo rje las //
analyzed: de yang dgyes pa'i rdo rje las //
translated: That is also taught in the Hevajra Tantra:

original: nor bu chu shel 'od 'dra zhing //
analyzed: nor bu chu shel 'od 'dra zhing //
translated: He is like the light of a crystal gem.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / dpal 'dus pa'i don ye shes zhabs kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / dpal 'dus pa'i don ye shes zhabs kyi zhal snga nas kyis kyang /
translated: And the glorious Guhyasamaja, the master of wisdom, also says:

original: zla ba rgyas pa'i mdangs ltar dkar pa la //
analyzed: zla ba rgyas pa'i mdangs ltar dkar pa la //
translated: White like the radiance of the full moon,

original: g-yas dang g-yon pa'i zhal ni sngo dang dmar //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon pa'i zhal ni sngo dang dmar //
translated: the right and left faces are blue and red.

original: zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir zla ba rdo rje sbyor ba yis te thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su gyur pa las gshin rje mthar byed bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir zla ba rdo rje sbyor ba yis te thabs dang shes rab snyoms par 'jug pa yongs su gyur pa las gshin rje mthar byed bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, therefore, one should meditate on Yamantaka through the yoga of the moon and vajra, that is, through the transformation of the union of means and wisdom.

original: 'di'i phyag dang zhal @87a * //
analyzed: 'di'i phyag dang zhal @87a * //
translated: His hands, faces,

original: dang mdog dang dbyibs ni rim par phye ba bzhi par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: dang mdog dang dbyibs ni rim par phye ba bzhi par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: colors, and shapes are to be accomplished in the fourth chapter.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdud rnams zhi bar bya phyir dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: bdud rnams zhi bar bya phyir dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The text says, “in order to pacify the demons,” and so on, which is easy to understand.

original: stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i rjes thogs su rnal 'byor pa'i srung ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i rjes thogs su rnal 'byor pa'i srung ba gsungs pa /
translated: Immediately after the meditation on emptiness, the protection of the yogi is taught:

original: rdo rje bsrung ba'i don du bsgom //
analyzed: rdo rje bsrung ba'i don du bsgom //
translated: Meditate on the vajra protection.

original: zhes bya'o// rang gi don rdzogs nas gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya'o// rang gi don rdzogs nas gzhan gyi don bya ba'i phyir gzhan gyi don sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor gsungs pa /
translated: Having perfected one’s own purpose, in order to perform the purpose of others, the emanation maṇḍala for the purpose of others is taught:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Then the Bhagavān, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de gti mug rdo rje gshin rje gshed la sogs pa bskyed pa ni nyid dang mtshungs pa'i chu skyes su rdzogs par byed pas ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de gti mug rdo rje gshin rje gshed la sogs pa bskyed pa ni nyid dang mtshungs pa'i chu skyes su rdzogs par byed pas ;
translated: All the Tathagatas, i.e., Mohavajra Yamantaka, etc., are generated in the lotus of his own nature, and are perfected.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skyed pa po ste /
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skyed pa po ste /
translated: Therefore, he is the generator of all the Tathagatas,

original: dpal gshin rje gshed nag po'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dpal gshin rje gshed nag po'i ngo bo'o //
translated: and is the essence of Sri Heruka.

original: gang gis bdud thams cad 'dul bar byed pa des ni mi phyed pa'i gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs de nyid rdo rje'o //
analyzed: gang gis bdud thams cad 'dul bar byed pa des ni mi phyed pa'i gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs de nyid rdo rje'o //
translated: Since he subdues all the Maras, he is the Vajra of Yamantaka, i.e., indivisible.

original: de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bstan to //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de skad ces bstan to //
translated: The samadhi is so-called because it is taught in that way.

original: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni der sems rtse gcig par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la snyoms par zhugs pa ni der sems rtse gcig par byas pa'o //
translated: The entry into that is the single-pointed mind in that.
