translated: There, having performed the yoga of Yamāntaka just as it is, having understood that one is seized by the bhūtas, etc., one should summon them, and having entered the body of the victim, bind them, and press them down with a vajra cross.

original: h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa gnyis kyis glo gnyis nas bcings la 'og tu 'bar zhing g-yo ba me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i bsgrub bya'i snying ga dang mgrin par bltas la /
analyzed: h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa gnyis kyis glo gnyis nas bcings la 'og tu 'bar zhing g-yo ba me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i bsgrub bya'i snying ga dang mgrin par bltas la /
translated: With two five-pronged vajras arisen from hūṃ, bind the two sides of the chest, and look at the heart and throat of the victim, who is standing on a blazing, moving fire maṇḍala.

original: h'um 'bar ba las byung ba'i rdo rje dang 'dra ba'i yungs kar gyi rgyal po la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bsngags nas lus nges par 'bigs par byed par bltas la /
analyzed: h'um 'bar ba las byung ba'i rdo rje dang 'dra ba'i yungs kar gyi rgyal po la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bsngags nas lus nges par 'bigs par byed par bltas la /
translated: Having enchanted mustard seed with the mantra one hundred and eight times, which is like a vajra arisen from a blazing hūṃ, one should look at the body, which is definitely pierced.

original: nga rgyal dang bcas pas sngags bzlas nas brdegs na nges par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang bcas pas sngags bzlas nas brdegs na nges par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one strikes with the mantra recitation, which has pride, one will definitely be liberated.

original: yang na lag pa gnyis la h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje 'bar ba bsgoms la des bzung ba'i lus la 'byung po la sogs pa bkug la /
analyzed: yang na lag pa gnyis la h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje 'bar ba bsgoms la des bzung ba'i lus la 'byung po la sogs pa bkug la /
translated: Or else, one should meditate on blazing vajras arisen from hūṃ in both hands, and having summoned the bhūtas, etc., that are seized by the body,

original: rdo rje gnyis kyi dbus su chud par byas la de'i 'od kyis bsregs shing rang gi lag pa'i rdo rje kha sbyor gyis btsir zhing mnyes la sngags bzlas na grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rdo rje gnyis kyi dbus su chud par byas la de'i 'od kyis bsregs shing rang gi lag pa'i rdo rje kha sbyor gyis btsir zhing mnyes la sngags bzlas na grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one should crush them with the vajra in the middle of the two vajras, and having burned them with the light of that, one should rub with the joined vajra of one’s hand and recite the mantra. One will be liberated.

original: rkang pas kyang mnye bar bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pas kyang mnye bar bya'o //
translated: One should also rub with the feet.

original: rtsal sprod pa ltar snying gnas kyang mnye zhing mnan par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsal sprod pa ltar snying gnas kyang mnye zhing mnan par bya'o //
translated: As if stretching, one should also rub and press from the heart.

original: yang na des zin par 'dod na de'i rnal 'byor byas la /
analyzed: yang na des zin par 'dod na de'i rnal 'byor byas la /
translated: Or else, if one wishes to be seized by that, one should perform the yoga of that.

original: mar ngo'i brgyad dam bcu bzhi la dur khrod kyi sol ba chu dang bcas pas spangs pa'i gos g-yon la mdung la bskyon pa'am /🔽mtshon gyis brgyab pa'am /
analyzed: mar ngo'i brgyad dam bcu bzhi la dur khrod kyi sol ba chu dang bcas pas spangs pa'i gos g-yon la mdung la bskyon pa'am / mtshon gyis brgyab pa'am /
translated: On the eighth or fourteenth day of the waning fortnight, on a cloth that has been abandoned in a charnel ground, together with charnel ground ash and water, draw a rākṣasa with a spear in his right hand and a human head and threatening forefinger in his left hand.🔽He is standing on a human corpse, his hair blazing upward, and he is angry.🔽He has a crown of a garland of skulls, and he is fierce.

original: dpyangs pa'i mi'i thod pa la dur khrod kyi sol bas h'um las byung ba'i mche ba rnon po gtsigs pa thod pa'i phreng ba'i rgyan can khro ba dang bcas pa /
analyzed: dpyangs pa'i mi'i thod pa la dur khrod kyi sol bas h'um las byung ba'i mche ba rnon po gtsigs pa thod pa'i phreng ba'i rgyan can khro ba dang bcas pa /
translated: He is wearing a loincloth of elephant hide, and he is adorned with all the charnel ground ornaments.🔽Draw him on a cloth that has been abandoned in a charnel ground, together with charnel ground ash and water.🔽Draw him on the left side of the cloth, and on the right side draw a human skull that has been struck by a weapon, or is hanging, or is from a charnel ground.

original: skra gyen du 'bar ba lag pa g-yas pa bsgreng ba ni gri gug ring po thogs pa /
analyzed: skra gyen du 'bar ba lag pa g-yas pa bsgreng ba ni gri gug ring po thogs pa /
translated: In the skull draw a fierce, wrathful hūṃ arisen from a hūṃ, with sharp fangs, adorned by a garland of skulls, with hair blazing upward, the right hand extended holding a long flaying knife,🔽and the left hand holding a human head and making a threatening forefinger gesture.

original: lag pa g-yon na mi'i mgo dang sdigs mdzub mdzad pa'i srin po bris la mi bsregs pa'i sol ba dang sa dang thal ba dang / bsgrub bya'i rkang rjes kyi rdul rnams las byas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar snga ma bzhin du sngags t'a la'i lo ma la bris pa bcug la /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon na mi'i mgo dang sdigs mdzub mdzad pa'i srin po bris la mi bsregs pa'i sol ba dang sa dang thal ba dang / bsgrub bya'i rkang rjes kyi rdul rnams las byas pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi snying gar snga ma bzhin du sngags t'a la'i lo ma la bris pa bcug la /
translated: Draw the rākṣasa, and in the heart of the image made from unburnt charnel ground ash, earth, and ashes, and from particles of the victim’s footprints, insert the previously written mantra on a birchbark scroll.

original: dug dang lan tshva dang ske tshe la sogs pas byugs pa'i gzugs brnyan thod pa gnyis par bcug nas /
analyzed: dug dang lan tshva dang ske tshe la sogs pas byugs pa'i gzugs brnyan thod pa gnyis par bcug nas /
translated: Having placed the effigy anointed with poison, salt, black mustard seed, etc. in the two skulls,

original: gnyi ga yang dgug pa la sogs pa byas nas bris pa'i thod pa de'i steng du kha thur @109a * //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang dgug pa la sogs pa byas nas bris pa'i thod pa de'i steng du kha thur @109a * //
translated: having summoned both, etc., having covered the lower face of the written skull with the other skull,

original: du bstan nas bkab la des de bzung bar bsams na rkang pas mnan cing dur khrod du nam phyed na khro ba dang bcas pas che ge mo zung shig ces bya ba'i bskul tshig dang bcas pas bzlas na nges par des 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du bstan nas bkab la des de bzung bar bsams na rkang pas mnan cing dur khrod du nam phyed na khro ba dang bcas pas che ge mo zung shig ces bya ba'i bskul tshig dang bcas pas bzlas na nges par des 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: one should imagine that it is holding it. If one recites the mantra while stepping on it with one's foot in the charnel ground at midnight with anger and the urging word seize [addressed] to a particular person, then it will certainly seize him.

original: sbyor ba 'di nyid kyis rims la sogs pas kyang 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di nyid kyis rims la sogs pas kyang 'debs par byed do //
translated: By this very method one can also be possessed by fever, etc.

original: de la tsha ba'i rims la ni dmar po skra dmar po 'bar ba gyen du 'greng ba'o //
analyzed: de la tsha ba'i rims la ni dmar po skra dmar po 'bar ba gyen du 'greng ba'o //
translated: In that case, for hot fever one should visualize a red [spirit] with red hair blazing upward.

original: grang ba'i rims la ni dkar ba dang gsus pa 'phyang ba ste /
analyzed: grang ba'i rims la ni dkar ba dang gsus pa 'phyang ba ste /
translated: For cold fever one should visualize a white [spirit] with a pendulous belly.

original: gnyi ga yang rkang pa gsum pa mgo gsum pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rkang pa gsum pa mgo gsum pa /
translated: Both have three feet, three heads,

original: lag pa gsum pa khro ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa gsum pa khro ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: and three hands, and are angry.

original: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsungs pa /
translated: This is taught:

original: gshin rje gshed rdo rje sbyor ba'i //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed rdo rje sbyor ba'i // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The Vajrayoga of Yamantaka.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa'i cho ga gsungs pa /
translated: The rite of prior repetition is taught:🔽What need is there to mention the yogi who repeats a hundred thousand times?

original: rnal 'byor bdag nyid 'bum bzlas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la smos ci dgos zhes bya ba ni 'grub pa nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor bdag nyid 'bum bzlas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la smos ci dgos zhes bya ba ni 'grub pa nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: How could he not be perfected?

original: 'di ni nges zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni nges zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of 'certainly'.

original: sgrub pa po'i gtor ma'i cho ga gsungs pa la /
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i gtor ma'i cho ga gsungs pa la /
translated: The rite of the practitioner's bali is taught:

original: nyin re 'am zhes bya ba ni rtag tu'o //
analyzed: nyin re 'am zhes bya ba ni rtag tu'o //
translated: 'Daily' means constantly.

original: zla re 'am zhes bya ba ni zla ba re re la nyin re'o //
analyzed: zla re 'am zhes bya ba ni zla ba re re la nyin re'o //
translated: 'Monthly' means daily in each month.

original: lo ni re re zhes bya ba ni lo re re la nyin re'o //
analyzed: lo ni re re zhes bya ba ni lo re re la nyin re'o //
translated: 'Yearly' means daily in each year.

original: gtor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi sbyin //
analyzed: gtor ma drug cu rtsa bzhi sbyin //
translated: 'Give the sixty-four bali offerings.'

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is the connection.

original: dus nam zhe na dus bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: dus nam zhe na dus bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: When is the time? The time is taught:

original: dbyu gu zhes bya ba la thun gcig gi brgyad cha ni dbyu gu'o //
analyzed: dbyu gu zhes bya ba la thun gcig gi brgyad cha ni dbyu gu'o //
translated: 'Muhurta' is one eighth of a watch.

original: de'i grangs gang zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i grangs gang zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How many of those? It is said:

original: drug cu rtsa bzhi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: drug cu rtsa bzhi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The number sixty-four is to be supplied.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: thun brgyad kyis mtshon pa'i nyin zhag gcig la dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thun brgyad kyis mtshon pa'i nyin zhag gcig la dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In one day, which is illustrated by eight watches, there are sixty-four periods.

original: dbyu gu'i sbyor ba la bzo ba'o //
analyzed: dbyu gu'i sbyor ba la bzo ba'o //
translated: This is the calculation of the periods.

original: de la yar ngo'i tshes gcig nas brtsams nas sna g-yon pa'i bug pa nas zla ba zhes bya ba'i rlung 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la yar ngo'i tshes gcig nas brtsams nas sna g-yon pa'i bug pa nas zla ba zhes bya ba'i rlung 'byung ste /
translated: Beginning with the first day of the waxing moon, the wind called “moon” arises in the left nostril.

original: de yang thun phyed khyab par gnas so //
analyzed: de yang thun phyed khyab par gnas so //
translated: It remains for half a watch, pervading the body.

original: de'i rjes la ni 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la ni 'pho ba ste /
translated: After that, there is a change.

original: thun phyed pa brgyad kyi par du byung nas nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun phyed pa brgyad kyi par du byung nas nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having arisen for eight half-watches, it disappears.

original: de bzhin du nub mo yang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nub mo yang ste /
translated: The same occurs at night.

original: 'di dag ni 'pho ba bcu drug go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'pho ba bcu drug go //
translated: These are the sixteen changes.

original: de la 'pho ba de re re la yang me dang rlung dang chu dang dbang chen gyi dbye bas skad cig bzhi la ni dbyu gu zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'pho ba de re re la yang me dang rlung dang chu dang dbang chen gyi dbye bas skad cig bzhi la ni dbyu gu zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In each of these changes, there are four moments, distinguished as fire, wind, water, and earth, which are called a period.

original: de la gang gi tshe steng du 'byung ba de ni me yin //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe steng du 'byung ba de ni me yin //
translated: When it arises above, it is fire.

original: logs gnyis su 'byung ba ni rlung yin /
analyzed: logs gnyis su 'byung ba ni rlung yin /
translated: The two sides are wind.

original: thur la 'byung ba ni chu yin /
analyzed: thur la 'byung ba ni chu yin /
translated: The downward direction is water.

original: dbus nas 'byung ba ni dbang chen yin no //
analyzed: dbus nas 'byung ba ni dbang chen yin no //
translated: The middle is earth.🔽It is said:

original: de la / gang tshe @109b dbus nas gang tshe steng //
analyzed: de la / gang tshe @109b dbus nas gang tshe steng //
translated: When it is in the middle, when it is above,

original: gang tshe yang ni glo gnyis nas //
analyzed: gang tshe yang ni glo gnyis nas //
translated: when it is in the two sides,

original: gang tshe 'og car khyab pa ni //
analyzed: gang tshe 'og car khyab pa ni //
translated: when it is below,

original: skad cig skad cig rlung 'byung ba //
analyzed: skad cig skad cig rlung 'byung ba //
translated: the wind arises moment by moment.

original: 'pho ba bzhi ni shes byas la //
analyzed: 'pho ba bzhi ni shes byas la //
translated: Having understood the four transits,

original: dbyu gu bzhi ru blta bar bya //
analyzed: dbyu gu bzhi ru blta bar bya //
translated: one should view the four periods.

original: ji ltar dbyu gu dbyu gu bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar dbyu gu dbyu gu bzhin //
translated: Just as the periods are the periods,

original: rab sbyor bdag nyid gtor ma sbyin //
analyzed: rab sbyor bdag nyid gtor ma sbyin //
translated: one should offer the self as oblation.

original: de bzhin du mar ngo la ni nyi ma zhes bya ba'i ming can sna khung g-yas pa nas 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mar ngo la ni nyi ma zhes bya ba'i ming can sna khung g-yas pa nas 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, in the waning phase, one should know that the wind arises from the right nostril, called the sun.

original: de ltar ches gnyis dang gsum gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de ltar ches gnyis dang gsum gyi bar du'o //
translated: In this way, for two and three days.

original: de nas bzhi pa yang nyi ma nas zla bar ro //
analyzed: de nas bzhi pa yang nyi ma nas zla bar ro //
translated: Then, in the fourth, it is from the sun to the moon.

original: de ltar lnga pa dang drug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de ltar lnga pa dang drug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: In this way, for five and six days.

original: de nas yang ldog ste tshes bdun dang brgyad dang dgu'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de nas yang ldog ste tshes bdun dang brgyad dang dgu'i bar du'o //
translated: Then, in reverse, for seven, eight, and nine days.

original: de nas bcu dang bcu gcig dang bcu gnyis kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de nas bcu dang bcu gcig dang bcu gnyis kyi bar du'o //
translated: Then, from the tenth to the eleventh and twelfth.🔽Then, from the thirteenth to the fourteenth and fifteenth.

original: de nas bcu gsum dang bcu bzhi dang bco lnga pa'i bar du ste zla ba phyed gang la dang po gang nas byung ba der tha mar nub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas bcu gsum dang bcu bzhi dang bco lnga pa'i bar du ste zla ba phyed gang la dang po gang nas byung ba der tha mar nub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The moon sets in the direction in which it rose.

original: nyin mo'i ji lta ba de bzhin du nub mo yang ngo //
analyzed: nyin mo'i ji lta ba de bzhin du nub mo yang ngo //
translated: The same for the night.

original: 'dir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i las bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i las bya'o //
translated: Here, one should do the good and bad actions, coming and going, etc.🔽There,

original: de la / sa dang chu la dge ba'i las //
analyzed: de la / sa dang chu la dge ba'i las //
translated: the good action is on the earth and in the water;

original: me dang rlung las nag po'o //🔽zla ba yang dag shes par bya //
analyzed: me dang rlung las nag po'o // zla ba yang dag shes par bya //
translated: the bad action is in the fire and in the wind.🔽The moon is known as the good action;

original: 'od rno ba la 'bring po yin //
analyzed: 'od rno ba la 'bring po yin //
translated: the sun is known as the bad action.

original: mi dge gal te nyi mar byas //
analyzed: mi dge gal te nyi mar byas //
translated: If the bad action is done in the sun,

original: de ni nges par 'chi ba ster //
analyzed: de ni nges par 'chi ba ster //
translated: it will certainly bring death.

original: de nyid zla bar byung gyur na //
analyzed: de nyid zla bar byung gyur na //
translated: If the good action is done in the moon,

original: shin tu sdug bsngal ster ba min //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: shin tu sdug bsngal ster ba min //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: it will not bring great suffering.

original: rtag tu cung zad ci za dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba gnyis gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu cung zad ci za dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i bya ba gnyis gsungs pa ste /
translated: Always a little of whatever is eaten, and so forth, speaks of two activities of the yogi.

original: phud ces bya ba ni dang po'o //
analyzed: phud ces bya ba ni dang po'o //
translated: The first is the first portion.

original: 'dis ni phyi'i gshin rje gshed tshim par bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyi'i gshin rje gshed tshim par bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: This speaks of the satisfaction of the external Yamantaka.

original: yang na rnal 'byor ba'i mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gzhan gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor ba'i mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gzhan gsungs pa ste /
translated: Or, it speaks of another special meditative concentration of the supreme yogi:

original: phud ces bya ba ni gong na med pa ste der ji ltar 'gyur ba de lta bur gshin rje gshed rang gis rig pa'i bdag nyid can la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phud ces bya ba ni gong na med pa ste der ji ltar 'gyur ba de lta bur gshin rje gshed rang gis rig pa'i bdag nyid can la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The first is the highest, and it is said that in that way, Yamantaka himself, whose nature is knowledge, and so forth.

original: da ni bla ma mnyes par gyur na dngos grub 'byung zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni bla ma mnyes par gyur na dngos grub 'byung zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to teach that when the guru is pleased, power arises, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: de nas yang dag bshad bya ba //
analyzed: de nas yang dag bshad bya ba //
translated: Then, I will explain the supreme secret,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: and so forth, which is easy to understand.

original: nye bar mkho ba'i khyad par thams cad ni phreng ba la sogs pa 'dus bya ba khyad par ro //
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba'i khyad par thams cad ni phreng ba la sogs pa 'dus bya ba khyad par ro //
translated: All the special necessities are the special collections of the rosary, and so forth.

original: gang du de lta bu bstan pa de yang nye bar mkho ba'i khyad par thams cad pa zhes bya ba'o //🔽dpal gshin rje gshed nag po'i dka' 'grel slob dpon shr'i dha @110a * //
analyzed: gang du de lta bu bstan pa de yang nye bar mkho ba'i khyad par thams cad pa zhes bya ba'o // dpal gshin rje gshed nag po'i dka' 'grel slob dpon shr'i dha @110a * //
translated: Where such is taught, that is called the all-inclusive special requirement.

original: ras mdzad pa las rim par phye ba bcu gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: ras mdzad pa las rim par phye ba bcu gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the twelfth chapter of the Sri-Chakrasamvara-panjika composed by the master Shrinatha.

original: // / da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshon cha'i rnam par dag pa sngon du 'gro ba'i nges pa'i chu la gsungs pa la /
analyzed: // / da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshon cha'i rnam par dag pa sngon du 'gro ba'i nges pa'i chu la gsungs pa la /
translated: Now, beginning with Then, the weapon purities are stated in the section on the definite water.

original: ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ji tsam yod pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed pa zhes bya ba ni tshad ji tsam yod pa'o //
translated: As many as there are means as much as there is.

original: gang mi dge ba'i rgyus sdig pa byas pa nyid ni sdig pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi dge ba'i rgyus sdig pa byas pa nyid ni sdig pa'o //
translated: Evil is that which is done by the cause of non-virtue.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni rnam pa kun du gcod cing 'bigs pas gri gug go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni rnam pa kun du gcod cing 'bigs pas gri gug go //
translated: Those are the cleaver and the sword.

original: shubs can ni ral gri ste nyon mongs pa nyid kyi dgra yin pas ral gri'o //
analyzed: shubs can ni ral gri ste nyon mongs pa nyid kyi dgra yin pas ral gri'o //
translated: The scabbard is the sword, because it is the enemy of the afflictions.

original: des gcod cing gshog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des gcod cing gshog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it cuts and severs them.

original: ring ba'i thos pa bsgrub pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i sgrub pa'i thabs gsungs pa la ring thos pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas so //
analyzed: ring ba'i thos pa bsgrub pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i sgrub pa'i thabs gsungs pa la ring thos pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas so //
translated: In order to accomplish the hearing of the distant, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then,” and so on, [teaching] the means of accomplishing the Vajraḍāka. The “hearing of the distant” is [hearing] over a long time.

original: kun du zhes bya ba ma lus pa'i rnam pa thos pa ni ring ba'i thos pa'o //
analyzed: kun du zhes bya ba ma lus pa'i rnam pa thos pa ni ring ba'i thos pa'o //
translated: “ Everywhere” means in all aspects. The “hearing of the distant” is the hearing of the entirety.

original: de bsgrub pa ni rdzogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bsgrub pa ni rdzogs par bya ba'o //
translated: “ Accomplishing that” is completing it.

original: de'i don du rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i don du rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: For that purpose, one should meditate on the Vajraḍāka.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'o //
translated: “ Space” is the sky.

original: de nyid ni khams te chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni khams te chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: That itself is the realm, the nature of all phenomena.

original: de'i dbus su gzhal yas khang ste der gtogs pa ni de'i khongs su gtogs par ro //
analyzed: de'i dbus su gzhal yas khang ste der gtogs pa ni de'i khongs su gtogs par ro //
translated: In the middle of that, one should imagine the celestial mansion. Belonging to that is included within that.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsam par bya //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor bsam par bya //
translated: One should imagine the sun maṇḍala.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: “ One should imagine” means one should meditate.

original: rtse lnga pa yang zhes bya ba ni gang la rtse lnga yod pa bde ni rtse lnga pa ste rdo rje zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gnas zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi yi ge ste /
analyzed: rtse lnga pa yang zhes bya ba ni gang la rtse lnga yod pa bde ni rtse lnga pa ste rdo rje zhes bya ba'i don to // gnas zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi yi ge ste /
translated: The five-peak is that which has five peaks, and that is the five-peak, which means the vajra.🔽The place is the seed syllable.

original: sa bon yi ge gnas zhes brjod //
analyzed: sa bon yi ge gnas zhes brjod //
translated: The place of the seed syllable is called the place.

original: ces bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de'i steng du zhes pa ni de'i lte ba'i dkyil du'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du zhes pa ni de'i lte ba'i dkyil du'o //
translated: Above that means in the center of its navel.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He says just that:

original: dhri zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dhri zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the dhṛ syllable.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is from its transformation.

original: nag po 'jigs rung ba zhes bya ba ni 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nag po 'jigs rung ba zhes bya ba ni 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: The black, terrifying is the frightening one.

original: g-yas dang g-yon pa'i zhal ni dkar po dang dmar po'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon pa'i zhal ni dkar po dang dmar po'o //
translated: The right and left faces are white and red.

original: phyag tu rdo rje rnam bsgom bya //
analyzed: phyag tu rdo rje rnam bsgom bya //
translated: One should visualize the vajra in the hand.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyag gi gtso bo na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyag gi gtso bo na'o //
translated: This is in the principal hand.

original: gzhan ni phyag gzhan dag la dgod //
analyzed: gzhan ni phyag gzhan dag la dgod //
translated: The others are the other hands.

original: ces bya ba ni phyag mtshan lhag ma ral gri dang / gri gug dang / 'khor lo dang / padma dang / thod pa rnams phyag gzhan dag na ste lhag ma lnga po la dgod par bya ba ste bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni phyag mtshan lhag ma ral gri dang / gri gug dang / 'khor lo dang / padma dang / thod pa rnams phyag gzhan dag na ste lhag ma lnga po la dgod par bya ba ste bsgom par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The remaining hand implements, the sword, flaying knife, wheel, lotus, and skull bowl, are to be placed in the other hands, in the remaining five. The meaning is that they are to be visualized.

original: sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dkyil 'khor ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The mandala of application is the mandala of the moon.

original: ral gri 'dzin ma zhes bya ba ni gang la ral gri yod pa de ni ral gri 'dzin ma'o //
analyzed: ral gri 'dzin ma zhes bya ba ni gang la ral gri yod pa de ni ral gri 'dzin ma'o //
translated: The sword-holder is the one who has a sword.

original: dkyil 'khor rim pa'o @110b zhes bya ba ni lha mo lnga po de dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rim pa'o @110b zhes bya ba ni lha mo lnga po de dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The mandala sequence is that those five goddesses are to be visualized in the center of the mandala.

original: 'dis ni dkyil 'khor rim pa gnyis par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dkyil 'khor rim pa gnyis par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the second mandala sequence.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: dkyil 'khor snga ma'i sna tshogs rdo rje med pa la ka ba brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor snga ma'i sna tshogs rdo rje med pa la ka ba brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The previous mandala is without a variegated vajra, and is beautified by eight pillars.

original: de la shar gyi ka ba gnyis ni 'khor lo'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la shar gyi ka ba gnyis ni 'khor lo'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The two eastern pillars are the nature of the wheel.

original: lho'i gnyis ni rin po che'i rang bzhin no //🔽nub kyi gnyis ni padma'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lho'i gnyis ni rin po che'i rang bzhin no // nub kyi gnyis ni padma'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The two in the south are of the nature of jewels.🔽The two in the west are of the nature of lotuses.

original: byang gi gnyis ni ral gri'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byang gi gnyis ni ral gri'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The two in the north are of the nature of swords.

original: gzhan dag thams cad ni snga ma bzhin no //🔽me la sogs pa'i mtshams bzhi ru //
analyzed: gzhan dag thams cad ni snga ma bzhin no // me la sogs pa'i mtshams bzhi ru //
translated: All the rest is the same as before.🔽In the four corners beginning with Agni

original: zhes bya ba ni me dang bden bral dang rlung dang dbang ldan gyi mtshams rnams su'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni me dang bden bral dang rlung dang dbang ldan gyi mtshams rnams su'o //
translated: means in the corners of Agni, Nirrti, Vayu, and Isana.🔽Lasya is white, dancing, Mala is yellow, holding a garland, Gita is red, dancing, and Nrtya is dark blue, singing.

original: l'a sye ma dkar mo gar byed pa'i tshul dang / phreng ba sor mo phreng ba 'dzin pa'i tshul dang / gar ma dmar mo gar byed pa'i tshul dang / glu ma sngo bsangs glu len pa'i tshul can te lha mo kun kyang phyag gnyis pa zhal gcig pa g-yon brkyang ba'i zhabs /
analyzed: l'a sye ma dkar mo gar byed pa'i tshul dang / phreng ba sor mo phreng ba 'dzin pa'i tshul dang / gar ma dmar mo gar byed pa'i tshul dang / glu ma sngo bsangs glu len pa'i tshul can te lha mo kun kyang phyag gnyis pa zhal gcig pa g-yon brkyang ba'i zhabs /
translated: All the goddesses have two arms, one face, and their left legs extended.

original: rin po che'i phreng ba 'dzin pa cung zhig khros pa'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: rin po che'i phreng ba 'dzin pa cung zhig khros pa'i gzugs can no //
translated: They hold jewel garlands and have slightly wrathful forms.

original: sangs rgyas mkha' 'gro ma nas brtsams nas ral gri 'dzin ma zhes bya ba'i bar gyi phyag dang zhal dang phyag mtshan dang kha dog gi 'khor lo ni snga ma bzhin blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mkha' 'gro ma nas brtsams nas ral gri 'dzin ma zhes bya ba'i bar gyi phyag dang zhal dang phyag mtshan dang kha dog gi 'khor lo ni snga ma bzhin blta bar bya'o //
translated: The wheel of the hands, faces, implements, and colors of the goddesses beginning with Buddhaḍākinī and ending with Khadginī should be seen as before.

original: aom badzra d'a ki n'i zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma la bod pa'o //
analyzed: aom badzra d'a ki n'i zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das ma la bod pa'o //
translated: Om Vajraḍākinī is offered to the Blessed Lady.

original: aom karma d'a ki n'i zhes bya ba ni las kyi mkha' 'gro ma la'o //
analyzed: aom karma d'a ki n'i zhes bya ba ni las kyi mkha' 'gro ma la'o //
translated: Om Karmaḍākinī is offered to Karmaḍākinī.

original: aom dharma d'a ki n'i zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mkha' 'gro ma la'o //
analyzed: aom dharma d'a ki n'i zhes bya ba ni chos kyi mkha' 'gro ma la'o //
translated: Om Dharmaḍākinī is offered to Dharmaḍākinī.

original: aom buddha d'a ki n'i zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas mkha' 'gro ma la bod pa'o //
analyzed: aom buddha d'a ki n'i zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas mkha' 'gro ma la bod pa'o //
translated: Om Buddhaḍākinī is offered to Buddhaḍākinī.

original: aom ratna d'a k'i n'i zhes bya ba ni rin chen mkha' 'gro ma la'o //
analyzed: aom ratna d'a k'i n'i zhes bya ba ni rin chen mkha' 'gro ma la'o //
translated: Om Ratnaḍākinī is offered to Ratnaḍākinī.

original: lam la sogs pa ni l'a sye la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lam la sogs pa ni l'a sye la sogs pa'o //
translated: Laṃ etc. is offered to Lāsyā etc.

original: aom mudha r'a dza zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgo skyong ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: aom mudha r'a dza zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgo skyong ba rnams la'o //
translated: Om Mudrā-rāja etc. is offered to the gate-keepers.

original: dgug pa la sogs pa'i sngags ni 'khor lo snga ma yin no //
analyzed: dgug pa la sogs pa'i sngags ni 'khor lo snga ma yin no //
translated: The mantras for summoning etc. are the same as before.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni bstan zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni bstan zin pa nyid do //
translated: This is what has been taught.

original: 'di lta bu'i bsgom pa ni sngon gyi bsnyen pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i bsgom pa ni sngon gyi bsnyen pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This kind of meditation is the preliminary rite.

original: der ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sgrub pa'i dus kyi bzlas pa'i sngags bstan te /
analyzed: der ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sgrub pa'i dus kyi bzlas pa'i sngags bstan te /
translated: There and so forth teaches the mantra recitation at the time of the rite.

original: aom a'a ka sha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom a'a ka sha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Om akasa and so forth.

original: sa 'og sgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: sa 'og sgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For the sake of the subterranean rite, it is said:

original: de nas yang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽yang dag ces bya ba ni yang dag par bshad par @111a * //
analyzed: de nas yang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la / yang dag ces bya ba ni yang dag par bshad par @111a * //
translated: Then, the perfect and so forth.

original: bya ba'o // yang dag pa nyid ni yang phyag 'tshal pa la sogs pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid dang / srung ba dang gur gyi nang du chud pa'i gzhal yas khang mngon par sprul la /
analyzed: bya ba'o // yang dag pa nyid ni yang phyag 'tshal pa la sogs pa thams cad dang / stong pa nyid dang / srung ba dang gur gyi nang du chud pa'i gzhal yas khang mngon par sprul la /
translated: The perfect is to be explained as the perfect. The perfect is all the prostrations and so forth, and the emptiness, and the manifestation of the celestial mansion within the protection wheel.

original: de'i dkyil du nyi ma la gnas pa'i hr'i: las skyes pa'i gnod mdzes rdo rje bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dkyil du nyi ma la gnas pa'i hr'i: las skyes pa'i gnod mdzes rdo rje bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should meditate on Sumbharāja Vajra born from the hriḥ on the sun in the center of that.

original: phyag drug pa snga ma bzhin du mtshon cha 'dzin pa /
analyzed: phyag drug pa snga ma bzhin du mtshon cha 'dzin pa /
translated: He has six arms, holding weapons as before.

original: rtsa ba'i zhal dang lus thams cad sngo ba /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i zhal dang lus thams cad sngo ba /
translated: The principal face and the entire body are blue.

original: g-yas dang g-yon pa'i zhal dkar ba dang dmar ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon pa'i zhal dkar ba dang dmar ba'o //
translated: The right and left faces are white and red.

original: phyag tu gtun shing zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i gnas su ste phyag gtso bo gnyis pa na'o //
analyzed: phyag tu gtun shing zhes bya ba ni rdo rje'i gnas su ste phyag gtso bo gnyis pa na'o //
translated: The pestle in the hand is the vajra position, that is, in the second principal hand.

original: dkyil dag tu zhes bya ba ni ka ba brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: dkyil dag tu zhes bya ba ni ka ba brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su'o //
translated: In the middle means in the middle of the maṇḍala beautified by eight pillars.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is what is to be explained.

original: shar du spyan ma ni dkar mo ste /
analyzed: shar du spyan ma ni dkar mo ste /
translated: In the east, Locanā is white,

original: zhal g-yas dang g-yon sngo ba dang dmar pa 'khor lo dang ral gri dang rin po che dang padma 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: zhal g-yas dang g-yon sngo ba dang dmar pa 'khor lo dang ral gri dang rin po che dang padma 'dzin pa'o //
translated: with a right and left face blue and red, holding a wheel, sword, jewel, and lotus.

original: lho ru m'a ma k'i sngon mo zhal g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dkar ba dang dmar ba rdo rje dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: lho ru m'a ma k'i sngon mo zhal g-yas pa dang g-yon pa dkar ba dang dmar ba rdo rje dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: In the south, Māmakī is blue, with a right and left face white and red, holding a vajra, sword, wheel, and lotus.

original: nub tu gos dkar mo dmar po zhal g-yas dang g-yon sngo ba dang dkar ba /
analyzed: nub tu gos dkar mo dmar po zhal g-yas dang g-yon sngo ba dang dkar ba /
translated: In the west, Pāṇḍaravāsinī is red, with a right and left face blue and white,🔽holding a wheel, sword, and lotus.

original: padma dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang nor bu bsnams pa /
analyzed: padma dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang nor bu bsnams pa /
translated: She holds a lotus, sword, wheel, and jewel.

original: byang du sgrol ma sngo bsangs zhal g-yas pa dang g-yon pa sngon po dang dkar po //
analyzed: byang du sgrol ma sngo bsangs zhal g-yas pa dang g-yon pa sngon po dang dkar po //
translated: In the north, green Tārā has a blue and white face.

original: ral gri dang 'khor lo dang nor bu dang padma bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: ral gri dang 'khor lo dang nor bu dang padma bsnams pa'o //
translated: She holds a sword, wheel, jewel, and lotus.

original: lha mo kun kyang g-yon brkyang ba khro ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo kun kyang g-yon brkyang ba khro ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: All the goddesses have a wrathful expression and stand with their left legs extended.

original: gri gug dang thod pas 'khyud pa'i tshul can no //
analyzed: gri gug dang thod pas 'khyud pa'i tshul can no //
translated: They embrace their consorts with their left hands, holding a skull cup, and with their right hands, a flaying knife.

original: me tog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: me tog ces bya ba ni /
translated: “Flower”

original: me tog ma me tog dkar po'i phreng ba lag tu thogs pa'o //
analyzed: me tog ma me tog dkar po'i phreng ba lag tu thogs pa'o //
translated: is Puṣpā, who holds a white flower garland in her hand.🔽“Incense”

original: spos zhes bya ba ni spos me ma spos snod lag tu thogs pa'o //
analyzed: spos zhes bya ba ni spos me ma spos snod lag tu thogs pa'o //
translated: is Dhūpā, who holds an incense holder in her hand.🔽“Lamp”

original: mar me zhes bya ba ni mar me ma mar me lag tu thogs pa'i tshul can no //
analyzed: mar me zhes bya ba ni mar me ma mar me lag tu thogs pa'i tshul can no //
translated: is Dīpā, who holds a lamp in her hand.🔽“Scent”

original: dri zhes pa ni dri'i dung phor thogs pa'i lag pa'i tshul can no //
analyzed: dri zhes pa ni dri'i dung phor thogs pa'i lag pa'i tshul can no //
translated: is Gandhā, who holds a scent conch in her hand.

original: me sogs mtshams su dgod ces bya ba ni me dang / bde bral dang rlung dang dbang ldan gyi mtshams rnams su go rims ji lta ba bzhin du dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: me sogs mtshams su dgod ces bya ba ni me dang / bde bral dang rlung dang dbang ldan gyi mtshams rnams su go rims ji lta ba bzhin du dgod par bya'o //
translated: peace, wind, and Isana, respectively.🔽The hammer, etc.

original: tho ba la sogs sgo ru ste //
analyzed: tho ba la sogs sgo ru ste //
translated: at the door

original: zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: is easy to understand.🔽This is what is said:🔽Having generated the Lord, one should generate the mandala

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das bskyed nas dkyil 'khor ba yang bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das bskyed nas dkyil 'khor ba yang bskyed par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: as well.🔽Having seen the rite,

original: cho ga mthong nas zhes bya ba la 'dir cho ga ni @111b 'khor lo snga ma nyid ltar ro //
analyzed: cho ga mthong nas zhes bya ba la 'dir cho ga ni @111b 'khor lo snga ma nyid ltar ro //
translated: here the rite is just like the previous wheel.

original: rmi lam ni mtshan ma nyid do //
analyzed: rmi lam ni mtshan ma nyid do //
translated: The dream is the very sign.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this:

original: rnal 'byor pa sngon du bsnyen pa byas la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa sngon du bsnyen pa byas la /
translated: The yogi, having performed the preliminary service,

original: bcom ldan 'das rmi lam gyi mtshan mar sa 'og gi khung bu ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rmi lam gyi mtshan mar sa 'og gi khung bu ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: the Lord will show the sign of the dream, the hole in the earth.🔽The vajra yogi should enter there.

original: der rdo rje sa 'og gi rnal 'byor pa 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der rdo rje sa 'og gi rnal 'byor pa 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.🔽Then, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mkha' spyod kyi dngos grub gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mkha' spyod kyi dngos grub gsungs te /
translated: teaches the power of moving in space.

original: 'dir yang gzhan thams cad ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang gzhan thams cad ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here, too, everything else is as before.

original: bdun pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba la bdun pa ste rta'o //
analyzed: bdun pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba la bdun pa ste rta'o //
translated: The king of the seventh is the horse.

original: de'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba'i rgyud la rgyal po ltar byed pas bdun pa'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: de'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba'i rgyud la rgyal po ltar byed pas bdun pa'i rgyal po'o //
translated: Because he acts like a king in the continuum of the disciple by means of that form, he is the king of the seventh.

original: dkyil 'khor snga ma dang de'i khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor snga ma dang de'i khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: The previous maṇḍala and its distinctions are stated:

original: phyag gnyis pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With two hands, etc.

original: sran gre'u khu tshur bcangs zhes bya ba ni sran gre'u brdungs pa dang bcangs pa'o //
analyzed: sran gre'u khu tshur bcangs zhes bya ba ni sran gre'u brdungs pa dang bcangs pa'o //
translated: The pea-sized fist is the pea-sized fist.

original: 'di dag snga ma gnyi ga'i sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di dag snga ma gnyi ga'i sngags gsungs pa /
translated: The mantras of both of these previous ones are stated:

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shar du zhes bya ba la sogs pas lha mo dgod pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa la shar du zhes bya ba la sogs pas lha mo dgod pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Om, etc. In the east, etc. The placement of the goddesses is easy to understand.

original: kha dog gi dbye ba yang bstan zin to //
analyzed: kha dog gi dbye ba yang bstan zin to //
translated: The color divisions have also been taught.

original: sngags 'di yis ni zhes bya ba ni yi ge hris so //
analyzed: sngags 'di yis ni zhes bya ba ni yi ge hris so //
translated: By this mantra with the syllable hrīḥ

original: gshegs su gsol ba ni phyung ba ste sprul pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gshegs su gsol ba ni phyung ba ste sprul pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The dismissal is the extraction up to the emanation.

original: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sngags nyid kyis dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyang sprul par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sngags nyid kyis dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyang sprul par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mantra of the Blessed One himself should emit the maṇḍala deities.

original: smyug ma'i gling bu ni gling bu nyid la ched du byed pa'o //
analyzed: smyug ma'i gling bu ni gling bu nyid la ched du byed pa'o //
translated: The bamboo flute is the flute itself.

original: pi wang ni pi wang nyid la ched du gtod pa'o //
analyzed: pi wang ni pi wang nyid la ched du gtod pa'o //
translated: The lute is the lute itself.

original: rnga zlum yang de bzhin te kha cig pags pas g-yogs pa ni rnga zlum mo //
analyzed: rnga zlum yang de bzhin te kha cig pags pas g-yogs pa ni rnga zlum mo //
translated: The drum is also like that, covered with skin on one side.

original: rnga bran ni pa tra ha chen po ste /
analyzed: rnga bran ni pa tra ha chen po ste /
translated: The small drum is the paṭaha,

original: de ni kha gyen du bstan nas brdung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni kha gyen du bstan nas brdung ba'o //
translated: which is beaten with the mouth facing upward.

original: 'di dag gi yang kha dog dang dgod pa'i gnas ni go rims bzhin shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi yang kha dog dang dgod pa'i gnas ni go rims bzhin shes par bya'o //
translated: The colors and positions of these should be understood according to the order.

original: ba lang rna dang glang po'i rna ni ming gis don go bar zad do //
analyzed: ba lang rna dang glang po'i rna ni ming gis don go bar zad do //
translated: The cow-eared and elephant-eared are self-explanatory.

original: gdong bzang gdong ngan zhes bya ba ni ming du chags pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: gdong bzang gdong ngan zhes bya ba ni ming du chags pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The good-faced and bad-faced are nominal sounds.

original: thams cad kyang khro bo'i gzugs so //
analyzed: thams cad kyang khro bo'i gzugs so //
translated: All of them have wrathful forms.

original: kha dog gi dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: kha dog gi dbye ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The color divisions are as before.

original: 'di dag gi phyag mtshan gsungs pa ni gtun shing dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi phyag mtshan gsungs pa ni gtun shing dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement of the hand implements of these is “with a pestle, etc.”

original: sgo bzhi ru ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //🔽ji ltar rta mchog sngags kyis ni //
analyzed: sgo bzhi ru ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o // ji ltar rta mchog sngags kyis ni //
translated: “In the four doors, etc.” is easy to understand.🔽As for “with the mantra of the supreme horse,”

original: zhes bya ba la rta mchog gi sngags de nyid rdo rje sa 'og gi sngags kyang de nyid yin no @112a * //🔽zhes bya ba'i dan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rta mchog gi sngags de nyid rdo rje sa 'og gi sngags kyang de nyid yin no @112a * // zhes bya ba'i dan to //
translated: that mantra of the supreme horse is also the mantra of the vajra underworld.

original: 'di bsgom pa'i sbyor bas cir 'gyur pa de gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di bsgom pa'i sbyor bas cir 'gyur pa de gsungs pa /
translated: The statement of what happens by the yoga of meditating on this is

original: khams gsum nam mkha'i khongs su rgyu ba ste yongs su 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum nam mkha'i khongs su rgyu ba ste yongs su 'khor ba'o //
translated: “moving in the realm of space of the three realms, i.e., cycling.

original: bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgom pa rab kyi mthar phyin pa na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one has perfected the meditation, i.e., the meaning.

original: gang du sa 'og tu 'jug pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub des par bstan pa'i le'u la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang du sa 'og tu 'jug pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub des par bstan pa'i le'u la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The chapter that teaches the powers of entering the underworld, etc. is called that.

original: dpal gshin gshed nag po'i dka' 'grel slob dpon shr'i dha ras mdzad pa las rim par phye ba bcu gsum pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: dpal gshin gshed nag po'i dka' 'grel slob dpon shr'i dha ras mdzad pa las rim par phye ba bcu gsum pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the thirteenth chapter in the commentary on glorious Black Yamari composed by the master Shrīdhara.

original: // / da ni sa gzung ba'i rjes thogs su thig gdab pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / da ni sa gzung ba'i rjes thogs su thig gdab pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, after the section on the ground, the section on the thread-cross is stated.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni sa gzung ba byas pa'i sa gzhi la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni sa gzung ba byas pa'i sa gzhi la'o //
translated: There means on the ground-place where the ground has been taken up.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This means what is to be explained.

original: srad bu zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi srad bu'o //🔽de rkyong ba'i phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog gang la yod pa de na srad bu brkyang ba'i dam tshig gi mchog ste /
analyzed: srad bu zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyi srad bu'o // de rkyong ba'i phun sum tshogs pa'i mchog gang la yod pa de na srad bu brkyang ba'i dam tshig gi mchog ste /
translated: The thread is the thread of gnosis.

original: rnal 'byor pas sems can bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir 'da' bar mi bya ba nyid do /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas sems can bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir 'da' bar mi bya ba nyid do /
translated: The supreme commitment of the thread-cross is that which has the supreme excellence of its extension, because it is the non-transgression by the yogi of the very thing that is the gathering of sentient beings.

original: srad bu de nyid mngon par bsngags pa'i sngags gsungs pa /
analyzed: srad bu de nyid mngon par bsngags pa'i sngags gsungs pa /
translated: The mantra of the consecration of that thread is stated:

original: a'a ka ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i de kho na nyid gsum gyis spel ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: a'a ka ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di la 'chad par 'gyur ba'i de kho na nyid gsum gyis spel ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Akaro and so forth. It should be understood that this is to be expanded with the three realities that will be explained.

original: slob ma rnam par snang mdzad du bsgom zhes bya ba ni gti mug gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs su dmigs par byas la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: slob ma rnam par snang mdzad du bsgom zhes bya ba ni gti mug gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs su dmigs par byas la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The disciples meditate on Vairocana means that one should visualize the form of Mohavajrī.

original: rang nyid ni dpal gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs dang ldan par ro //
analyzed: rang nyid ni dpal gshin rje gshed kyi gzugs dang ldan par ro //
translated: One should visualize oneself as having the form of glorious Yamāntaka.

original: ye shes thig mchog rtse mo'i rtse //
analyzed: ye shes thig mchog rtse mo'i rtse //
translated: The tip of the peak of the supreme thread of gnosis

original: zhes bya ba ni ye shes ni yakshe ma me dang zhes bya ba'i sa bon gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ye shes ni yakshe ma me dang zhes bya ba'i sa bon gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: means that gnosis is the essence of the seed syllable yakṣe mame.

original: des bskyed pa'i lha'i bdag nyid can gyi gzugs ni ye shes kyi thig go //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i lha'i bdag nyid can gyi gzugs ni ye shes kyi thig go //
translated: The form of the deity generated by that is the thread of gnosis.

original: de ni dri zhim po lngas bsgoms pas mchog go //
analyzed: de ni dri zhim po lngas bsgoms pas mchog go //
translated: That is supreme because it is meditated on with the five fragrances.

original: rtse mo ni ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rtse mo ni ye shes kyi 'khor lo'i ngo bo de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The peak is the tathāgatas, the essence of the wheel of gnosis.

original: de zhugs pas rtse mo'i rtse mo ste gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de zhugs pas rtse mo'i rtse mo ste gtso bo'o //
translated: Since they enter there, the tip of the peak is the principal one.

original: de nas / ye shes thig mchog rtse mo'i rtse //
analyzed: de nas / ye shes thig mchog rtse mo'i rtse //
translated: Then, the tip of the peak of the supreme thread of gnosis🔽means that one should visualize the form of the deity generated by the seed syllable in the heart of the principal one.🔽The tip of the peak is the supreme thread of gnosis.

original: shin tu mnyam par gzhag pas zhes bya ba ni phyogs dangs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu mnyam par gzhag pas zhes bya ba ni phyogs dangs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: With great equipoise means skilled in the pure directions.

original: phyogs kun mnyam pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: phyogs kun mnyam pa nyid kyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: It has the nature of the equality of all directions.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni so shing bza' pa la sogs pa thams cad bsgrubs nas so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni so shing bza' pa la sogs pa thams cad bsgrubs nas so //
translated: There means having accomplished all the chewing of tooth wood and so forth.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This means what is about to be explained.

original: dkyil 'khor chen por 'jug pa la //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen por 'jug pa la //
translated: Entering the great maṇḍala,

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor @112b chen por 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor @112b chen por 'jug pa ste /
translated: means entering the great maṇḍala.

original: slob ma zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: slob ma zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The disciple is the remainder.

original: de nyid 'da' bar mi bya ba yin pas dam tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid 'da' bar mi bya ba yin pas dam tshig go //
translated: Since that should not be transgressed, it is a pledge.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is stated:

original: aom a'a: h'um don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ. The meaning is as follows:

original: sngags 'di zlos shing slob ma gzhug par bya la dkyil 'khor bri ba'i dus su re kh'a'i nang du 'jug cing phyir 'byung bar yang bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di zlos shing slob ma gzhug par bya la dkyil 'khor bri ba'i dus su re kh'a'i nang du 'jug cing phyir 'byung bar yang bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Reciting this mantra, the disciple should enter, and at the time of drawing the maṇḍala, he should also recite it while entering and emerging within the lines.

original: dkyil 'khor nyis 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni thig skud kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor nyis 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni thig skud kyi khyad par ro //
translated: With the maṇḍala is doubled and so forth, the characteristics of the thread are stated.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob mas gsang ba'i dbang la sogs pa'i gsol ba gdab pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob mas gsang ba'i dbang la sogs pa'i gsol ba gdab pa bstan to //
translated: The words there and so forth teach the disciple's request for the secret empowerment and so forth.

original: yang de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa'i lha mo dgug pa'o //
analyzed: yang de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa'i lha mo dgug pa'o //
translated: Again, the words there and so forth summon the earth goddess.

original: sgo ni dkyil 'khor brgyad cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sgo ni dkyil 'khor brgyad cha zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The words the door is one-eighth of the maṇḍala and so forth teach the characteristics of the maṇḍala.

original: 'di dag thams cad dkyil 'khor gyi cho gar rgyas par bstan pas dgrol bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad dkyil 'khor gyi cho gar rgyas par bstan pas dgrol bar mi bya'o //
translated: Since all of these are taught extensively in the maṇḍala ritual, they should not be unraveled here.

original: dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa gsungs pa de nas zhes bya ba ni bris zin nas so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bsgrub pa gsungs pa de nas zhes bya ba ni bris zin nas so //
translated: The words then, and so forth teach the accomplishment of the maṇḍala. Then means after it is drawn.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa chen po rnams kyi snying po ni 'byin pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa chen po rnams kyi snying po ni 'byin pa'i sngags so //
translated: The great essence of the tathāgatas and so forth is the mantra that is emitted.

original: 'dis byed pa'i don gyi gsum pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis byed pa'i don gyi gsum pa ste /
translated: This is the third [case] of the meaning of the causative.

original: snying po chen po yis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying po chen po yis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is by the great essence.

original: bdag nyid ni rang ste 'khor lo dgong ces snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid ni rang ste 'khor lo dgong ces snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: One's own means oneself. Drawing the maṇḍala is connected to the previous [line].

original: rang gi phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rang snang pa der bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i rang snang pa der bstan pa'o //
translated: One’s consort is taught to be that one’s own appearance endowed with the characteristics as taught.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this:

original: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor bsgrubs la /
analyzed: rdul tshon gyi dkyil 'khor bsgrubs la /
translated: Having accomplished the maṇḍala of colored powder,

original: der blos rnam par gnas nas rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor sngon du 'gro bas rang snang ba'i chu skyes su dkyil 'khor mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: der blos rnam par gnas nas rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor sngon du 'gro bas rang snang ba'i chu skyes su dkyil 'khor mngon par sprul nas /
translated: having mentally dwelled there, having previously performed the yoga, subsequent yoga, and great yoga, having emanated the maṇḍala in the lotus of one’s own appearance,

original: 'byin pa'i sngags kyis bton la gnas ji lta bar bkod te dkyil 'khor bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byin pa'i sngags kyis bton la gnas ji lta bar bkod te dkyil 'khor bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: having extracted it with the extraction mantra, having arranged it in its own place, one should accomplish the maṇḍala.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to clarify that, it is said:

original: dam tshig yi ge zhes bya ba la yang dag par 'gro zhing rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes thob par byed pas dam tshig ces rang snang ba'i rig pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dam tshig yi ge zhes bya ba la yang dag par 'gro zhing rnam par mi rtog pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ye shes thob par byed pas dam tshig ces rang snang ba'i rig pa la bya'o //
translated: The pledge syllable is the knowledge that generates the attainment of the gnosis that has the nature of going perfectly and being nonconceptual.

original: de'i yi ge ni mi 'gyur zhing ngo bo nyid las mi 'pho bas rang gis rig pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de'i yi ge ni mi 'gyur zhing ngo bo nyid las mi 'pho bas rang gis rig pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The syllable is the pristine awareness that is one's own awareness, because it is immutable and does not move from its own nature.

original: dam tshig gi yi ge des byang chub kyi sems kyi dkyil 'khor bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gi yi ge des byang chub kyi sems kyi dkyil 'khor bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: By that pledge syllable, one should accomplish the mandala of the spirit of enlightenment.

original: nges par bskyed par bya ba ni dkyil 'khor bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par bskyed par bya ba ni dkyil 'khor bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish the mandala means that one should definitely generate it.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las kyang @113a * //
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las kyang @113a * //
translated: And in the glorious Guhyasamaja🔽it is said:🔽The so-called bhaga mandala,🔽the mandala of the spirit of enlightenment,

original: bha ga'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya dang // byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor dang // lus kyi dkyil 'khor zhes gsungs pas //
analyzed: bha ga'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya dang // byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor dang // lus kyi dkyil 'khor zhes gsungs pas //
translated: and the mandala of the body:

original: dkyil 'khor rnam pa sum du brtags //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rnam pa sum du brtags // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: thus one should imagine three mandalas.

original: 'di dag ni dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga dang bla ma las gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga dang bla ma las gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These are clearly explained in the mandala rituals and in the teacher's instructions.

original: shar du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dkyil 'khor gyi kha dog rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: shar du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dkyil 'khor gyi kha dog rdzogs par byed do //
translated: The line in the east, etc., completes the mandala's colors.

original: phyag rgya dgod pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dgod pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya dgod pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dgod pa'o //
translated: Arranging the seals means arranging the signs.

original: las kyi cho ga mthong nas ni //
analyzed: las kyi cho ga mthong nas ni //
translated: Having seen the ritual of action,

original: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi cho gar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi cho gar bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught in the mandala rite.

original: dkyil du zhes bya ba ni dbus kyi gdan la rdo rje bri ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil du zhes bya ba ni dbus kyi gdan la rdo rje bri ba'o //
translated: In the center means on the central seat one should draw a vajra.

original: shar du ni 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: shar du ni 'khor lo'o //
translated: In the east is a wheel.

original: de lta bu la sogs par blta //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs par blta //
translated: One should look at such things.

original: zhes bya pa la rin po che dang padma dang ral gri rnams ni lho dang nub dang byang du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya pa la rin po che dang padma dang ral gri rnams ni lho dang nub dang byang du'o //
translated: The jewels, lotuses, and swords are in the south, west, and north.🔽The wheels, vajras, lotuses, and swords are in the fire,

original: 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang padma dang ral gri rnams ni me dang bden bral dang rlung dang dbang ldan rnams su'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang padma dang ral gri rnams ni me dang bden bral dang rlung dang dbang ldan rnams su'o //
translated: rākṣasa, wind, and īśāna directions.

original: tho ba dang dbyug pa dang padma dang ral gri rnams ni shar la sogs pa'i sgor ro //
analyzed: tho ba dang dbyug pa dang padma dang ral gri rnams ni shar la sogs pa'i sgor ro //
translated: The hammers, clubs, lotuses, and swords are at the eastern and other doors.

original: thod pa bzhi ni mtshams bzhir bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: thod pa bzhi ni mtshams bzhir bri bar bya'o //
translated: The four skull-cups are to be drawn in the four intermediate directions.

original: phyag mtshan kun du zhal dang mtshungs //
analyzed: phyag mtshan kun du zhal dang mtshungs //
translated: All the hand implements are the same as the faces.

original: zhes bya ba ni zhal dang 'dra ba ni zhal dang mtshungs pa ste zhal gyi gtso bo dang mdog 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhal dang 'dra ba ni zhal dang mtshungs pa ste zhal gyi gtso bo dang mdog 'dra ba ste /
translated: The faces are the same as the faces. The principal face is the same color as the faces.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi gtso bo dang 'dra ba'i phyag mtshan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal gyi gtso bo dang 'dra ba'i phyag mtshan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “hand implement resembling the Bhagavān’s face” is that.

original: de la 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dgang gzar dang blugs gzar gyi tshad bstan te go sla'o //
analyzed: de la 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dgang gzar dang blugs gzar gyi tshad bstan te go sla'o //
translated: Here, the phrase “by this” and so forth teaches the measure of the ladle and the measure of the spoon. It is easy to understand.

original: da ni rgyud kyi che ba'i bdag nyid /
analyzed: da ni rgyud kyi che ba'i bdag nyid /
translated: Now, the greatness of the tantra is taught

original: dkyil 'khor du ni ma zhugs dang // zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs pa ste /🔽gshin rje gshed rgyud mngon gzhol nas //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du ni ma zhugs dang // zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs pa ste / gshin rje gshed rgyud mngon gzhol nas //
translated: beginning with the line “Those who have not entered the maṇḍala” and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed kyi rgyud la gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gshin rje gshed kyi rgyud la gcig tu mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The line “who are devoted to the Yamāri Tantra” means who are devoted to the Yamāri Tantra.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: sngar de ltar zhugs pa dag phyi nas gshin rje gshed kyi rgyud rnyed pa las de dang de yongs su btang na /
analyzed: sngar de ltar zhugs pa dag phyi nas gshin rje gshed kyi rgyud rnyed pa las de dang de yongs su btang na /
translated: Those who have previously entered in that way, later, having obtained the Yamāri Tantra, having given up this and that,

original: de'i yon tan rnyed pas 'dod pa'i don grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i yon tan rnyed pas 'dod pa'i don grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: by obtaining its qualities, will accomplish the desired aim.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: 'grub par 'di la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'grub par 'di la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “Here, one will attain” and so forth.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bor nges par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i ngo bor nges par 'grub pa'o //
translated: It is certain that one will accomplish the essence of the great seal.

original: yang na thams cad kyang ji ltar gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor pa la de ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: yang na thams cad kyang ji ltar gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor pa la de ltar gsungs te /
translated: Or else, all of this is taught in that way to the yogi/nī who is nondual.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus ba las kyang /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus ba las kyang /
translated: And in the glorious Guhyasamāja,

original: mi bya ba ni cung zhig @113b med //
analyzed: mi bya ba ni cung zhig @113b med //
translated: there is nothing at all that is not to be done,

original: de bzhin mi bza' cung zhig med //🔽mi smra pa yang ci yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin mi bza' cung zhig med // mi smra pa yang ci yang med //
translated: there is nothing at all that is not to be eaten,🔽there is nothing at all that is not to be said,

original: kun du mi bsam ci yang med //
analyzed: kun du mi bsam ci yang med //
translated: there is nothing at all that is not to be thought,

original: mnyam par ma bzhag rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: and the yogi/nī who is not in equipoise

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa yin // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: is always in equipoise.

original: gal te dkyil 'khor du zhugs shing dbang bskur ba thob pa la lhan dngos grub gsungs nas /
analyzed: gal te dkyil 'khor du zhugs shing dbang bskur ba thob pa la lhan dngos grub gsungs nas /
translated: If it is said that one who has entered the maṇḍala and obtained initiation will attain the siddhi of the deity,

original: dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs pa dang / dbang ma bskur ba la 'grub par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du ma zhugs pa dang / dbang ma bskur ba la 'grub par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how will one who has not entered the maṇḍala and has not been initiated attain it?

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: nag pos gsungs pa'i tshig bzhin du //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nag pos gsungs pa'i tshig bzhin du // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Just like the words spoken by Kāṇha.

original: nag po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: nag po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Kāṇha is the Bhagavān Vajradhara.

original: de'i tshig ni gsung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshig ni gsung ngo //
translated: His words are spoken.

original: de yang gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa ste /
translated: And that is spoken,

original: rgyud ma lus par bstan pa'i dbang bskur ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i cho ga'i rnam pas zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rgyud ma lus par bstan pa'i dbang bskur ba la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i cho ga'i rnam pas zhes bya bar dgongs so //

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i chos bstan pa'i rjes thogs su'o //

analyzed: byams pa la sogs kyis zhes bya ba ni byams pa la sogs pa gzhan dag gis kyang ngo //
translated: Maitreya, etc., means that others such as Maitreya, etc.,

analyzed: rdo rje nges pa ni dbye rmed pa'i ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid kyi nges pa'o //

analyzed: mi smra bar ni sdod par gyur //
translated: They remained silent

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtog pa ma lus pa bsal nas dag gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i chos mngon sum du byas pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: means that after dispelling all conceptual thoughts, they were endowed with the direct realization of the Dharma that transcends the domain of thought.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor du slob ma do mtshar dang yid ches pa skyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor du slob ma do mtshar dang yid ches pa skyed pa'i phyir /

analyzed: rdo rje dbab pa gsungs pa 'byung ba bzhi zhes bya ba nas ltar bsil ba zhes bya ba'i bar ni go sla'o //

analyzed: gnas pa zhi ru ni zhes bya ba ni mgo dang snying gar dang lte ba dang rkang pa rnams su'o //

analyzed: spyor ba khyad par can gyi dkyil 'khor gyi cho gar bstan to //
translated: The special practice is taught in the mandala ritual.

original: 'phar bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lta bar 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'phar bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni lta bar 'gyur pa ste /
translated: “ One will fly” means one will rise up.

original: nam mkha' la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //

original: gnod sbyin mo'i sgrub thabs gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnod sbyin mo'i sgrub thabs gsungs pa /
translated: The Yakṣiṇī Sādhana is taught.

original: de nas yang dag bshad bya ba //
analyzed: de nas yang dag bshad bya ba //
translated: “ Then, I will explain🔽the Yakṣiṇī sādhana. ”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang dag ces bya ba ni yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang dag ces bya ba ni yang dag pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: “ Correctly” means according to the correct meaning.

original: dkyil 'khor sgrul pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor sgrul pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The mandala sādhana is as before.

original: phyag gnyis pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: phyag gnyis pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: “ Two-armed” and so on are easy to understand.

original: h'um las bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: h'um las bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: “ Born from hūṃ” is the remainder.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: sngags pas sngon du bsnyen pa byas la /
analyzed: sngags pas sngon du bsnyen pa byas la /
translated: The mantrin should first perform the recitation.

analyzed: ral gcig ma'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas gzhon nu mas bkal ba'i skud pa las byas pa'i ras kha tshar @114a * //
translated: Having the yoga of Ekajaṭī, he should draw the yakṣiṇī on a cloth made of thread spun by a young girl,

original: ma bcad pa la gnod sbyin mo mngon par bris te rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: ma bcad pa la gnod sbyin mo mngon par bris te rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa /
translated: uncut on the edges, adorned with various ornaments,

original: lang tsho la bab pa sgeg pa'i ro ldan pa /
analyzed: lang tsho la bab pa sgeg pa'i ro ldan pa /
translated: in the prime of youth, with a charming form,

original: shing chen po dang mya ngan med pa'i shing dang / aa mra'i me tog dang 'bras bu dang bcas pa gang yang rung ba zhig la lag pa g-yon pas reg pa /
analyzed: shing chen po dang mya ngan med pa'i shing dang / aa mra'i me tog dang 'bras bu dang bcas pa gang yang rung ba zhig la lag pa g-yon pas reg pa /
translated: touching with her left hand a great tree, an aśoka tree, or a mango tree with flowers and fruit,

original: lag pa g-yas pa mchog sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa mchog sbyin pa'o //
translated: and with her right hand bestowing boons.

original: de'i mdun du me tog dang / spos dang / bshos gtsang phul la rang gi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas mtshan mo bzlas pa byas nas nyi ma bdun na 'ong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i mdun du me tog dang / spos dang / bshos gtsang phul la rang gi rnal 'byor dang ldan pas mtshan mo bzlas pa byas nas nyi ma bdun na 'ong bar 'gyur //
translated: Having offered flowers, incense, and pure oblations in front of her, one should perform the recitation at night, endowed with one’s own yoga. In seven days she will come.

original: 'ongs nas kyang me tog dri zhim po dang chu gtsang ma'i yon chab dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'ongs nas kyang me tog dri zhim po dang chu gtsang ma'i yon chab dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Having come, she will offer fragrant flowers and pure water oblations.

original: des 'grub par 'gyur te ma dang sring mo dang chung ma'i tshul gyis byung na ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du tha snyad du bya'o //🔽yang na dur khrod kyi sol bar mar ngo'i gang yang rung ba zhig la rtsig ngos sam /
analyzed: des 'grub par 'gyur te ma dang sring mo dang chung ma'i tshul gyis byung na ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du tha snyad du bya'o // yang na dur khrod kyi sol bar mar ngo'i gang yang rung ba zhig la rtsig ngos sam /
translated: If she comes in the manner of a mother, sister, or wife, one should address her as appropriate.

analyzed: spang leb la mtshan ma snga ma bzhin du bris la de dgug cing bcug la /
translated: Alternatively, on a charnel ground wall or a wooden board, one should draw the previously described sign with menstrual blood on the fourteenth day of the month.🔽Summoning her, one should block her vagina with one’s hand and, as before, not speak to anyone else.

original: skye gnas su lag bas bkab nas snga ma bzhin du gzhan dang ci yang mi smra bas sngags zlas na de nas zhag bdun na de 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye gnas su lag bas bkab nas snga ma bzhin du gzhan dang ci yang mi smra bas sngags zlas na de nas zhag bdun na de 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, after seven days, she will come.

original: 'ongs nas stobs kyis kyang sgrub pa po 'dod par byed do //
analyzed: 'ongs nas stobs kyis kyang sgrub pa po 'dod par byed do //
translated: Having come, she will satisfy the practitioner’s desires by force.

original: brtse ba'i tshig tu smra bar byed do //
analyzed: brtse ba'i tshig tu smra bar byed do //
translated: She will speak loving words.

original: 'jigs pa'i tshul yang bstan to //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i tshul yang bstan to //
translated: She will display fearsome behavior.

original: de lta na yang 'jigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'jigs par mi bya'o //
translated: Even so, one should not be afraid.

original: smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not speak.

original: de lta na yang sbyor ba'i rjes thogs su 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang sbyor ba'i rjes thogs su 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, she will be accomplished in the wake of the practice.

original: gang dang gang rnal 'byor pa 'dod pa de dang de 'dod pa'i rtsed mo byas pas ster bar byed do //
analyzed: gang dang gang rnal 'byor pa 'dod pa de dang de 'dod pa'i rtsed mo byas pas ster bar byed do //
translated: Whatever the yogin desires, he will obtain it by playing with her, as desired.

original: de ltar yang ma grub na gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor ram /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma grub na gshin rje gshed kyi rnal 'byor ram /
translated: If even this is not accomplished, then by the yoga of Yamântaka or

analyzed: ral gcig ma'i rnal 'byor gyis rdo rje lcags kyu spros la lcags kyus skye gnas phug la ma gul nas zhags pas bcings te bkug la /
translated: the yoga of Ekâgra, one should emanate a vajra hook, and with the hook one should pierce her womb, and having bound her with a noose, one should summon her.

original: de'i mgo la gshin rje gshed bskal ba'i me dang 'dra ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mgo la gshin rje gshed bskal ba'i me dang 'dra ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize Yamântaka, blazing like the fire of the aeon, on her head.

original: 'og tu ni me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'og tu ni me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: Below is a circle of fire.

original: de nas khro ba dang bcas pas de'i ming gi tshig dang bcas pa'i hr'i: shatri: la sogs pa'i sngags sam /
analyzed: de nas khro ba dang bcas pas de'i ming gi tshig dang bcas pa'i hr'i: shatri: la sogs pa'i sngags sam /
translated: Then, with wrath, one should recite the mantra of Hriḥ-çikhī, etc., together with her name,
